Reviews.Title: “Surprise”
Reviews.Author: BracknellTwitto
Reviews.Content: Don't expect a run of the mill hotel, this place has a certain style,that you begin to appreciate once your eyes become accustomed to the gloom!Fabrics and room scents abound, Quirky collections mixed with some beautiful antiques and chandeliers. The staff were very helpful, nothing appeared too much trouble.Breakfast had everything we required and great coffee. The dinner menu looked great but was expensive. Nit picking,the pillows were too hard and the shower/wet room could have been more powerful. Not suitable for children or if you want somewhere modern and minimalist. Brilliant location with it's own landing stage. We certainly will return

Reviews.Title: “April 2012”
Reviews.Author: 317David
Reviews.Content: This hotel was poor for the price. I marked as terrible because of an incident with the staff over charging for water - on leaving I received two charges for water one for water they said I had used from the minibar and one for water I had used which was left out on the dressing table. We didn't take water from the minibar and thought the water on the dressing table was complementary - amazing to think it wouldn't be!!. I explained that I hadn't used any water from the minibar but they didn't believe me.The manager kindly waived the 24Euro charge for the water on the dressing table and was very easy to deal with. Expected tea making facilities in the room. Bath failed to drain and was very small. - not bad but not great. The room was covered in red fabric from floor to ceiling and on all the furniture. We stayed four nights . The staff were pleasant Also, the air con didn't work and when you opened the one small window with no view of the alley below all you heard was people through the night. The bathroom was okay but the bathtub did not drain (we had to use the bottle opener to prop it open to drain). The location is very convenient so that adds a couple positive points being steps away from most sites

Reviews.Title: “Nice respite for weary travelers”
Reviews.Author: Beachcomer2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is different and unique. It may not be everyone's style, but I really liked it. It has a bohemian flair. The sitting area downstairs is comfortable and a nice spill over area for jet lagged travelers. The bar is trendy and a bit expensive, but again comfortable, wit great service. The room we had was excellent- large, with a decent bathroom, window over a small canal.

Reviews.Title: “Really Special”
Reviews.Author: donnahalifax
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 3 nights at The Metropole for my 50th Birthday and it was amazing. We were treated so well from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. The hotel is a gem full of character and our room was lovely. Breakfast was included and could not be faulted. The location is perfect for any part of venice you may wish to visit. I can not think of a better place to have spent my birthday. Thank you to all the staff - can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Easter Break”
Reviews.Author: Derbygirl295
Reviews.Content: The hotel was full of antiques and very charming. The staff were warm and welcoming offering advice and assistance when requested but not intrusive. Our room was beautifully furnished and had a small balcony (but not big enough to walk onto), it was certainly furnished very comfortably and was beautifully decorated. The staff could not have been more helpful when I had my mobile stolen during a walk around venice and were keen to assist me. The hotel had a beautiful garden with organge trees and it is possible to eat breakfast there when the weather allows. The location of the hotel is perfect and I disagree with previous comments that the hotel is not 3 star - I consider that it certainly is. My only comment would be that tea or coffee making facilities in the room are essential, but having said that its a small point to make in an otherwise fantastic hotel. We will certainly be going back.

Reviews.Title: “What a room !”
Reviews.Author: Ray V
Reviews.Content: We booked a family room and received more than we hoped for: a huge square room, like 8 by 8 meters, with a very high ceiling, making it look even bigger ! The interior of the room was what one would imagine when thinking of Venice: two antique king size beds and a lot of old paintings, velvet, mirrors, chandeliers, etc. The room - nr 311 - was overlooking a small canal and with a bit of effort you could see the lagoon from the side. At night you could hear the sea rolling into the little canal what was very calming. The bathroom was a bit on the small side with only one sink but was neat and functional. All personnel was very friendly and genuine, always ready to help and assist. Each doorway of the hotel looks a bit like a museum, nothing wrong with that, while the bar is very cosy and inviting. On the culinary side we expected more from a +90 EUR menu and honestly found better restaurants (big thanks to Trip Advisor for that) during our four day stay. Breakfast was fine but nothing special: just your average â€˜continental breakfastâ€™ day after day, but the (couple of) tables in the garden square and especially the very friendly staff made up for that. All in all we will have very good memories of this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “metropole venice”
Reviews.Author: ley123
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a perfect central location and is charming inside,full of quirky antiques and red materials.I have to say however that this is by no means a 5 star hotel as promised, I booked a superior delux room with a lagoon view, for a special occasion and was so dissapointed, the room was tiny and overlooking the sea taxi ticket office on the lagoon,which had a flag pole outside one of the windows.I asked for another room but was told I would have to pay even more money for a suite, which after viewing, was certainly not worth it.Overall it just is not special enough and does not at all deserve its star rating, after checking out, you even have to pay a 30 euro tax to help them pay towards the up keep of the museums and galleries,not good, you really felt like a number and not a valued customer !

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of calm in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Alison B
Reviews.Content: The Metropole Hotel is perfectly situated within yards of the lagoon, the vaporetto stations and easy walking distance from the famous square of San Marco, The Staff could not have been more pleasant or helpful and made you feel as if you had been going there for years and deserving of special attention. All the bustle of Venice is outside the front door, but the minute that you step inside, all is calm and cool. The restaurant has two Michelin Stars and check out the absolutely charming courtyard garden where meals can be served in summer. Arrive by water taxi from the airport, wind your way along narrow canals and step into another world!.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Debra T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a short break in Venice, I am pleased we did. We both had A really nice, relaxing, luxury break. We decided to get the public transport boat from the airport. It cost 25 euro's each return. A private taxi boat costs around 90 euro's each way! The down side the public water taxi takes about 90 minutes. When we arrived ( boat station not far from hotel) the staff where friendly and helpful. Our room a 'classic double' was small but nice, the bathroom was also good and had every thing you need. We had the hotel breakfast which was expensive (28 euro's each) but very nice, a civilised start to the day. The hotel bar was nice with lots of atmosphere, the service good and the staff friendly. The hotel realised it was my birthday and invited us both to have a nice glass of proseco. We decided to try the hotel resturant, the food was good and brilliant service, the cost was about 140 euro's. We would defiantly go back, overall a good hotel in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Super location; declining over the years”
Reviews.Author: Crwydryn2
Reviews.Content: We first visited here in 1977, and at about 2-3 year intervals since. All the positive things written by previous reviewers remain true - good location, fine public rooms. Yet we have perceived a gradual decline in attentiveness, with initial reception being pleasant rather than warm, the bar service professional rather than personal. As everywhere else in Venice, the prices seem to rise each year out of proportion to the rest of Italy, and we are beginning to feel that there are other many other choices of merit in the same price bracket. Do beware when booking a room with balcony - they range from real balcony to a simple step outside an attic room - the latter being poor value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms, Not Convinced by the Staff”
Reviews.Author: BeachedExplorers
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Metropole in Venice was a real mixed bag... Pros: 1. Delicious room service from the Oriental Bar - the prosciutto crudo, and the prawn salad were stand out dishes 2. Lovely room - although in the traditional Venetian style, it had been cared for and looked beautiful. We were in room 319 with a great view overlooking the water. 3. Good restaurant recommendation - the recommendation to eat at Oliva Nera, just behind the hotel, was fabulous!! The best food we had in Venice. 4. The museum - each floor of the hotel had a different collection of antique objects (everything from religious icons to fans), and they were fun to look at and very unique. 5. Bath salts - I love to find a hotel that gives out proper bath salts, as well as the usual shower gels and shampoos! 6. Excellent location - close to the Vaporetto and gondola service points. An easy 5 minute walk to St Mark's Square. Cons: 1. The bathroom - as someone else said, this rather felt like a glorified Travelodge ensuite. The floor was tiled beautifully in golden mosaic, but the rest of the decor felt tired and average. The over bath shower proved quite messy, as it was impossible to move it to a position where it didn't shoot water over the side of the bath (probably because the bath was TINY!). The shower curtain had definitely seen better days - I can't remember the last time I saw one of those horrid, plastic shower curtains in a hotel of this standard. The cover over the overflow 'valve' was plastic and not attached to the bath, so it repeatedly fell into the bath. 2. Towels were thin compared to what is standard in most hotels of this quality. 3. Concierge - on our first day, we asked for two places (with specific addresses), and these were marked on the map given to us by the concierge. Both - we were told - were on the main campo in S Polo, and we wouldn't be able to miss them because it was such a small area. The two addresses were both a good ten minute walk from the places the concierge had marked on the map. It seemed to be laziness, given that we had exact addresses with street names and numbers! On the first night, we arranged a water taxi to a ball. My husband confirmed with reception the name of the venue twice. We came down to reception, and were told that the taxi for our room had arrived. It took us to the wrong venue and - not knowing Venice - we didn't realise until the taxi had left. To give them their due, the hotel did refund the extra 60 Euro we had paid for another taxi to the correct location. However, this refund was accompanied by excuses that they didn't recognise us because we were masked (we weren't, and the person who had escorted us to the taxi had said our room number); that there were no available water taxis so people had to share (we didn't); that four water taxis arrived simultaneously (they didn't, and we didn't see any other ball goers when we arrived in reception to catch our water taxi); that there was a language barrier (nobody asked us where we were going, as the concierge had booked the taxi, therefore, no opportunity for us to even encounter a language barrier!). We had been promised on Sunday morning that the water taxi debacle would be investigated, but when we came to check out on Monday, no one had bothered to look into it, so we had to spend almost twenty minutes waiting to check out. The eventual rectification and apologies were much welcomed. Conclusions It would have been a 3 or 4 rating, if we hadn't had such a nightmare with the concierge / reception service. The rooms are lovely, and the food excellent. The rectification of mistakes by the concierge / reception team, and their many apologies showed that they do care about their reputation. But the fact that someone promised to investigate and didn't bother when we first reported our taxi issue is unforgivable. Go back? Don't think so...

Reviews.Title: “One of Many choices”
Reviews.Author: abarasol
Reviews.Content: You can love this hotel or hate it. Nice "old fashioned" European hotel near St. Marks... if that is where you want to be. We prefer to avoid the crowds. The Metropole Hotel offers many types of accommodations that come with a steep price. Our stay was pleasant, starting off the morning with a nice buffet breakfast in the garden.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Wonderful Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Melissaleonardrealtor
Reviews.Content: My husband & 2 kids stayed there in August 2011. It was an excellent location walking 5 mi nutes to St. Mark's Square. Staff was very kind. Rooms were large & clean, plenty of room for all 4 of us. Bathroom was clean & spacious. Breakfast was delicious. We only had 1 night there after we came off of our 12 night cruise but wished that we had more and would definitely come again. The front desk arranged a private water taxi & a driver for our bags once we got there for us to go to the airport the next day which was very helpful. Loved everything about it & it exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in venice”
Reviews.Author: steveboi
Reviews.Content: We arrived in freezing conditions and where made fell wonderful, the staff are fantastic Angelo the bar supervisor is great looking after us. After a few disastrous meals we decided to eat at the hotel in the Oriental bar as the restaurant is closed for make over!! wow the food is the best in venice we have decided to eat here for the next 2 days as i dont think we will find better!!!! well done Metropole for fantastic service...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: stevieboy99
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Venice after 2 nights, stayed at the Metropole Hotel. Arrived at the Hotel by private water taxi, which was immense, well worth the Â£90 each way. Hotel overall is very nice, staff are very attentive & all speak good English, garden is lovely & location is fantastic. We went for a Deluxe Room, which was nice & a lot quirky, loads of antiques although very clean, the room could do with a little updated. The only issues that I found really & let down this apparent 5 star hotel, was the bathroom, which is tiny, like a well decorated travelodge. The bath was tiny (impractical to have a bath unless you were 10 or less), the water pressure on the over the bath shower was not good (not a power shower) & basically crammed tight, even included a B -Day, which was strange in such as small room. Also, there was no extra pillows & no tea or coffee facilities in the room, not what I would expect in a four star hotel, never mind a supposed five star. Overall experience of this hotel was good, mainly because its in a fantastic location with great staff. However, it isnt a five star hotel by international standards in my opinion, If you accept its four star then that would be about right.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mingyau
Reviews.Content: we arrived the hotel by booking a water taxi at the airport that delivered us directly to the dock. what a great way to arrive to venice. this year we spent our xmas holidays in venice for 3 nights staying at the metropole hotel. it is definitely a very unique hotel with lots of history. our family with 2 kids really enjoyed this hotel. it is definitely in a great location easy to get to everywhere and the water taxi stands are right in front of the hotel. a few minutes walk to san marco piazza. my advice when booking a hotel in venice would be location, location, location. i saw many people carrying their luggage to find their hotel somewhere more inside venice. Make sure you book a hotel that is easily accessible. we decided not to get a room facing the lagoon, and that was perfectly fine. you see the lagoon all day and we didn't miss it at all in the evening. my only complaint about this hotel is the front staff. they were not the most helpful with advice about the city. just gave me a book and said everything you want to know is in here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Ashish29
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Italy, this was the last place we were visiting and wasn't sure of the location of the property despite assurance from the agent. However, what we got was an amazingly located property with St. Marks square just 2 bridges and 5-7 min walk away, with a deep sense of history attached to it. Apparently this hotel has the only Michelin starred restaurant in whole of Venice!! Very easy to locate, very helpful and courteous front desk. We stayed in a mini suite and to say the least, it was superb! The size of the bathrooms was unexpected of in European properties!! The breakfast was good, although very limited for us vegetarians, and the spill over for the restaurant was beautifully landscaped..not to miss to sit and dine there, weather permitting. All in all a lovely stay...and if I ever return to Venice, this is without a doubt going to be the place where I would want to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Not really all that great!”
Reviews.Author: L S
Reviews.Content: I would say the only good thing about this hotel is it's location. The hotel and it's interiors are pretty frumpy and in fact quite smelly. The staff is not friendly at all and also pretentious. Amost every day they asked if we wanted to dine at their Michelin star restaurant and luckily we didn't because the times we enjoyed most while we were in Venice was when we were out of this hotel. Our room was at the back on the first floor and right on top of their kitchen we assume because we were constantly waking up with noises of throwing of trash and empty bottles into the trash cans or conversations and laughters between the kitchen staff at their backyard. The worst of all was, on the day of our check out we were called from the front desk about three times as king when would check out and we were threatened to be charged next nights rate if we didn't leave on time. I really can't stand this much of inflexiblibility after having stayed there two nights and paid quite a remarkable fee. I don't think we ll stay there ever again, I am pretty sure there are better value for our money in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, quiet, nicely decorated. Very good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Julie K
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels we stayed during our trip to Italy, we liked the Metropole the best. It was so quiet and I loved the furnishings. Inside it was almost castle-like with the draperies and furniture. The breakfast buffet was very good too. Lots and lots of choices. Eggs, breads, meats, yogurt, cereals. All fresh and good. Lots of places to sit in solitude and read, indoors and outdoors (large patio). Housekeeping was thorough and efficient. I would love to go back to Venice. If I ever do, I'll certainly stay again at the Metropole.

Reviews.Title: “So elegant, so unique”
Reviews.Author: inci61
Reviews.Content: We travel to venice once or twice a year for 10 years partly because of the Metropole hotel. It has a glorious view and is located very close to the historic center yet not so much crowded. The hotel an impressive collection of antiques. It has also very elegant and charming decorium with unique furniture and antique pieces. The staff is very kind and you feel the elegant luxury at every step in the hotel. You'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “A class act”
Reviews.Author: Mike N
Reviews.Content: This hotel represents outstanding value in one of the most expensive cities in the world, the room the view and the service were all first class. After eating out several times in average restaurants that were expensive we decided to eat at the MET restaurant within the hotel, it was one of the best meals we have ever had and with the wine included was cheap by Michelin star standards. We could not fault the hotel and if we return to Venice we will look no further than the Metropole.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Venice”
Reviews.Author: pbgv11
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the beautiful and somewhat edgy Metropole Hotel by private water taxi that delivered us to the hotel's private dock. The location overlooking the grand canal is perfect yet once you enter the hotel you are in an oasis removed from the tourist scene. The hotel is decorated with impressive collections of antiques from Venice's noble past. The effect is on a carefully decorated and orchestrated space not like a standard hotel more like a large villa. The rooms were exquisite with silk rippled fabric walls and a venetian glass chandelier. Our room had a balcony overlooking a small canal with a view to the grand canal. The breakfast room and buffet were perfect with the same attention to detail evident in the rest of the hotel. There is an exquisite walled garden room and outdoor garden to have your breakfast or a drink in the warm weather. The staff was extremely helpful. We were on vacation to celebrate a special wedding anniversary and the hotel was outstanding. We could walk to all the major attractions easily from the hotel. There is an intimate bar and restaurant on site. This is a very special property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location! Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Bob H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropole for two nights with our 14 and 11 year old daughters. The Metropole offers a family room that easily sleeps four which was perfect for us. The downside was a view of the building next door. Prior to arrival I arranged a private water taxi to the hotel from the airport through the concierge. Very quick response and he offered alternatives. Definitely recommend the water taxi directly to the hotel! Staff were all friendly and made good restaurant recommendations. The bar and sitting room are very cool. Service in the bar was very friendly, but a bit slow. Great place to unwind after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Our Italy Vacation”
Reviews.Author: KGREENW7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome, Florence, and Venice in hotels of the samer rating an the Metropole was BY FAR the best of the bunch. We weren't enamoured with Venice as a whole, but the hotel was great and the staff was incredible. I was overwhelmed by tourists all over Venice, but the staff at Metropole was the friendliest in Italy and they made us totally comfortable. The room was great and the food and drink excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: Born2Traveller
Reviews.Content: My husband spent the week there to celebrate my birthday. It was our first visit, we usually stay at the Danielli. This hotel was perfect. The staff kind and helpful, and not grumpy and suffering from tourism burnout, as they do at the Danielli. Everyone was cheerful, service spot on and the breakfast and bar wonderful. I was very surprised to see we got such a large and well appointed room without having upgraded. This place is a class act among a lot of others that really make a tourist feel exploited. Bravo!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: Allan M
Reviews.Content: Just fantastic, Really nice looking, very very cool!

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel in the Crown”
Reviews.Author: milesfish
Reviews.Content: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A8zUo7-lmHQ&feature=related A jewel. The Metropole is one of the jewels in the crown of five star Venetian Hotels. It is visually stunning with a location that is prime. Staff is courteous, helpful and well informed. The Metropole is expensive but worth every euro; balcony and terrace rooms are worth the extra. My Youtube video of the common rooms is attached to the top of this review.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay was as good as our first one 8 years ago.”
Reviews.Author: InesitaNorwich Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well-located, three bridges from St Mark's Square. Rooms are comfortable and quiet. The buffette breakfast can be taken in their lovely garden and transport to the airport by water taxi is convenient, if very expensive at 110 euros. The staff are helpful but our room was not ready till 2 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: melissa l
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 kids 8 & 10 years old just stayed at this hotel. It was a 2 min walk to St. Mark's square. It was right on the water. The hotel arranged a private water taxi for us to the airport. It really was a great location. It was 1 min from the vaparetto stop but we needed a private water taxi because we had too much luggage and couldn't go over the bridge with it. Rooms were very clean & spacious. Bathrooms were very clean & nice too. They had a free water taxi to murano too. They included the breakfast buffet and it was very good. we were sad to leave but would definitely stay there again. It was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “We didn't get five star treatment.....”
Reviews.Author: Busychick3
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, we were ignore by the concierge when we arrived. Then the bell hop kept us waiting so we had to ask the front desk to bring our bags up. Then, they didnt even do that -- after waiting 20 minutes for our bags, my husband found our bags in the middle of the lobby, unattended, and brought them up. On top of that, my Amex agent told me that we were promised a complimentary dinner at a nearby hotel as part of the package, but they never gave it to us. We left the hotel inside of two days.....we were promised adjacent or adjoining rooms but were on separate sides of the floor, not even close.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: ProfT
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay many weeks early on expedia, and by the time I got their prices had skyrocketed. As a result, I expected to be put in a cubbyhole of a room. (I had booked Classic Double for single use.) Instead, I was given a huge room with king bed, foyer area, and beautiful furnishings. That came along with two personalized notes from the guest room manager welcoming me. The air conditioning worked perfectly, which was needed! And contrary to some earlier posts, wifi is available -- free -- in rooms and I had no trouble at all connecting. The staff is superb. Both completely professional and yet very friendly. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Venetian boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidayqueen36
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this charming hotel in a twin-bedded standard room on the 3rd floor with my mother for 4 nights. Its in a very central location. We really liked the decor of the hotel it was typically Venetian, with a little Middle Eastern theme too. My favourite place was the salon where we had tea one afternoon, see pics. The reception areas are beautifully decorated and luxurious. There are antiques and collectibles all over the hotel which we loved as we are both collectors. Our room was a little tired but then the hotel is very old and I suppose it gave it a feeeling of authenticity. It was small and there was not a lot of space to walk around the beds. It was clean however, with a nice bathroom and plethora of toiletries (including bath salts): these are good quality and replenished daily. Lighting is very limited but we only really used the room for sleeping so this wasn't a problem. Then again if they could improve the lighting they should. We both slept well and the beds were comfortable, soundproofing on the floor above us was a bit of an issue on the last night as there was a noisy family staying above us and that disturbed our rest. The service at reception and in the restaurant was polite and professional. Breakfast was delicious and I really enjoyed the homemade breads and jams. I still crave their peach jam which was the best I have ever had. Wifi Internet access was free for me but this could depend on your hotel package, I was given a user id and password at reception and then could use wifi in my room and around the hotel. My overall asessment is that It was an expensive hotel for the type of room we selected but we chose it for its central location and style. We enjoyed it, but if you want a bright airy room with all the mod cons and space, go for a cheaper 3 star and then book an executive suite. You would however probably forego the delicious breakfast with organic produce. Be warned food in Venice is generally expensive and disapointing!

Reviews.Title: “antique hotel well located”
Reviews.Author: ladu08
Reviews.Content: refurbished maintaining original style, although without the possibility to incorporate modern comfort like air extractor in the bathroom. Good breakfast. Beds could be renewed, not in the decoration, that is part of the style, but in the straighteness.

Reviews.Title: “Manages to be quaint & friendly in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: celesteram
Reviews.Content: You would never know that throngs of tourists are emptying out of water buses, gathering on the waterfront and walking by the front of the hotel as you enjoy breakfast or an after dinner drink in the garden bar of the Metropole Hotel. We spent two very enjoyable and comfortable nights here, and couldn't ask for more friendly and attentive service from the front desk, the concierge, and the wait staff. The location is close to the heart of the city, San Marco square, but it's also very easy to access the less trodden areas from this location. Our room & bathroom was plenty large enough for us, as we didn't spend much time there in such a wonderful city full of gorgeous views, intimate restaurants and fun walks. The hotel helped us plan departure back to the mainland in a water taxi. They picked us up on the canal right off the lobby. Very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sofisticat
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel thru booking with EasyJet and it was fantastic! Nothing was too much trouble. The location was perfect (only two bridges away from St Markâ€™s Square) and the views across the water were fantastic. Being so close to the front and St Markâ€™s Square it probably wasnâ€™t the quietest hotel weâ€™ve ever stayed in but, we werenâ€™t exactly hoping for a quiet country type retreat, but wanted to hear the fun of Venice. Having said that, it wasnâ€™t crazy and we slept very well. The building was fantastic and I can highly recommend this hotel. It was EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Positano75
Reviews.Content: This is a very highly rated hotel with 2 star Michelin rated restaurant. The decor is garish. I felt as if I had entered a cheesy flea market. The owner apparently has a penchant for collecting assorted knick-knacks which he enjoys sharing with his guests. Our floor was a repository for an unending assortment of crucifixes. Our room (321) was ungodly hot with a poorly performing air conditioner. When I complained, I was informed that there was nothing they could do as it was an "old hotel". When I told them that our friends' room next door was cool the gentleman at the front desk(Peter) said that we should sleep with them! The bathtub would not drain. The hand-held shower did not work. The front desk personnel were at best condescending, at worst, downright rude. Save your money. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: Slayridez06
Reviews.Content: great location - good service - helpful staff - the whole place can double as a museum. would definitly stay there again when in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, we'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: SusanFE
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Venice with my 11 YO daughter. Hotel was fantastic, great location! Our room was quite elegant, very comfortable and had everything we needed. Breakfast was great -- good food, wonderful setting and very relaxing (my preteen slept quite late so I lingered over the paper & coffee for awhile). But by far the most impressive was the staff -- incredibly helpful, charming & fun. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: FineStepinghorses
Reviews.Content: The place appeared to be of 4 star quality but was very disappointing. The bagggage handling is very poor. You park on the other part of town and while the hotel recommended boat taxi service advertises bag service you are on your own. The staff appeared to have Attention Deficiet Disorder. We couldn't get anyones attention during check in. At check out the front desk was multitasking and the experience was poor. We did enjoy the room and the unique building. Too bad the service was so poor.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel full of mystery and old-world luxury.”
Reviews.Author: HalaK_2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful surprise. So full of character, so classy and gorgeous. We spent almost as much time exploring the hotel as we did exploring Venice! The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful, the location is ideal and the hotel itself was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel with First Class Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: FairyPowderPuff
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and we chose to stay at the Hotel Metropole as we were arriving in Venice late in the evening and it seemed extremely easy to get to with luggage - and on arrival this proved us right. It faces the stunning Canale Di San Marco and is only a five minute walk to Piazza San Marco. From where the hotel is located, we never needed to get the 'tragetto'. The Metropole also offers free boat trips to the island of Murano from the Hotel. Although we got a standard room it was still very nice. It overlooked a side canal and it was really fascinating to see the boats pass by just below you. The decor of the Hotel gives it a character of its own which I loved. Breakfast was simple but very good and their MET Restaurant was second to none. It has two Michelin Stars and the food is to die for and the service is excellent. I would highly recommend the Hotel Metropole and look forward to returning in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: drdrjack
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful romantic hotel, which was was full of antiques and old style opulence-definitely not for those who want a modern minimalistic light hotel.It was close to St Mark's Square and the water taxi stops ,so a great location.The breakfast was tasty and very well presented,and the staff attentive and helpful in every way.My only niggle woud be that there were no tea/coffee making facilities or WiFi in the rooms which would have been nice at the end of a busy days sight seeing, but in no ways detracted from our stay.We would definitiely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE.”
Reviews.Author: KilkennyCatEire
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Venice. Stayed at the Metropole for 3 nights. It was super, unforgettable. This was our 25th Wedding anniversary and the Metropole made it so special for us. Such a beautiful hotel with gorgeous antiques and every corner you go around was different. The staff were great and couldnt do enough for us. When we arrived what a surprise when a knock came to our door and here they were with a bottle of champagne!!. Such a lovely surprise and a nice touch. The breakfast was fantastic as was the lunch in the garden. It is very central to everywhere and a few minutes walking distance to Marks Square. It was a real haven to walk into the hotel from the busy streets. We loved the Metropole and look forward to returning. The rooms can get very warm but we found this only a minor problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Susansvaca
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Air conditioning heat unit doesnt work in a common sense way.Call front desk to ask. Had to have windows open in March. We had a nice dated room with access to an upstairs private terrace. It was great to chill up there and watch the boats and cruise ships come down the grand canal. Hotel recommended a murano glass tour and we were hesitant after all we knew about the aggressive approach they take. After talking to the hotel about our concerns we decided to book. It was a good interesting experience, private boat to Veteria artisitca vivarini in murano. Restaurant Trattoria do forni was recommended. We hated it. Antique collections were amazing.The decor in our kids room was very elegant and their room was a lower price point than ours but slept 3. We did not go to breakfast the first day. It is definitely worth going to the breakfast as they did a lovely job. The presentation was nice and the food was good. Try the hot chocolate kids. Wished we had gone on day one. Very nice garden. Did not try the Michelin restaurant. Maybe if we would have been kid free. Loved the acccess to San Marco square and the vast area that we could walk to.. This was a great location for teens and had a better vibe for a young family. We did not find noise to be an issue this close to San Marco. We could hear the church bells up on the terrace but not in the room. With the windows open we could occasionally smell the canal below. We were on the 4th floor so not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but friendly hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Alison538
Reviews.Content: This hotel fits the bill for a family with older children. The decor is opulent and stylish, and the location - near St Mark's Square, on the waterfront is perfect. We did not try the Michelin 2 Star restaurant as we did not think the children would appreciate it enough - but there were reasonable restaurants within walking distance. The breakfast was excellent, and the staff were friendly and welcoming. Really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel room for families”
Reviews.Author: froggie95
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a delightful 4 days in Venice. My daughter and her husband and her 3 young children stayed at the Hotel Metropole. It was delightful. Great location, near San Marco convenient for catching pigeons, lovely friendly staff, bus ferries stop directly in front of hotel....most of all a wonderful spacious 'family bedroom' with 2 king beds, a sofa and room to play on the floor. I stayed in the 4 person 'family room' with the 3 kids. Really recommend this hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort , elegance and value.”
Reviews.Author: aypejay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the end of February 2011 . We had been here in September 2008 but wanted to return for the famous Carnival. This is a superbly run hotel with pleasant, friendly staff who go out of their way to help. Great location for St Marks square and some really good restaurants ( Osteria Oliva Nera is the best of them ). In summer, breakfast in the garden at the rear is a unique experience for Venice. This city is one we keep revisiting and we will not be staying anywhere other than the Metropole.

Reviews.Title: “EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: BottmanFamily
Reviews.Content: From East Midlands in England to Marco Polo Venice, then a water taxi ride to the Metropole Hotel. (Taxi 100 euro) Arrived direct to the hotel where after ringing the bell the porter and hotel staff collected our bags. The staff at the from desk were very helpful and the porter carried the bags to the room and showed us where everything was. After a quick change we went exploring with tour map as provided by the hotel. HOTEL The hotel is old world as is much of Venice so I would expect it to be hard to find a untra modern hotel anywhere. Reception was small but clean, tidy and the staff were always their to help. The hotel has two small lifts leading to your rooms from the reception area. Rooms are locatred on four floors. Our room was a junior suite with a lagoon view. We were based on the fourth floor and also had stairs from the door up to a balcony on the roof which in summer must be wonderful with a view over the roof tops of Venice and a view of the lagoon the other way. (It was too cold to spand much time on the roof in January). Bedroom was a reasonable size and had a separate area with tv and settee. The bathroom had sink, wc, bath and a tap shower with no shower curtain which made it very difficult to have a shower. Their was no separate shower. FACILITIES The hotel has a bar next to the main enterance which has low back ground music and helpful staff. But it is very expensive (Round of 4 drinks 70 euro every time). Breakfast was served a the rear dinning room of the hotel and was clean, tidy and had attentive staff. It was mainly a continental breakfast where you help yourself, however you could also have scambled eggs and thin bacon. The staff served you endless coffee which was of good quality. Evening meal was served in the main restaurant and was a ** Michelin. We ordered the sample menu which was 10 courses and included such delights as pigeon, hare, fros gras, caviar etc. The meal lasted 4 and a half hours and I could swear we had 12 to 14 courses as they did not include a chef's pre-desert and palet cleansers in betweeen courses. 'FANTASTIC'. The set menu started at 125 p.p. euro without wine. etc. The hotel does not have a spar or a swimming pool and this is not unusual for Venice as space is limited. VENICE Venice was great, but be prepared to pay top dollar for everything. Saw no cars for 4 days. TIP Take plenty of money and you will enjoy yourself. We went with firends and enjoyed every minute,

Reviews.Title: “wow ,you won,t be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Aussiemum69
Reviews.Content: Wow, we arrived at this beautiful hotel by water taxi .The venetians are such lovely people from the Taxis to the hotel staff all were wonderful. Our room was georgous, spacious ,very quite and soothing. breakfast was delicate refreshing and just delicious,the staff attentive and gracious We loved Venice and will be back as soon as we can ( from Australia). It was the most interesting ,personal hotel we have ever stayed at . Well done metropole Venice you seem to have the recipe for a success hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean, not a five star, need to be renovated, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: susamilu
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were in Venice for a we break, we had a 2 st floor side view, which was so old and used that it seems to be in some grandmama house. Wiring doesn't work at all we had no light in the room for 4 times in 1 day... finally we heard a bang on the wall, and it stinks, then we changed the room to a suite that was horrible, ridiculous, decorated with winged cherubs. There were pistachio shells on the floor and remains of fruit, in front of the bed a television prehistoric encased in a theater... Everything was old and worn. Absolutely one of the worst hotel I have ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “if you love antiques, this is the hotel for you”
Reviews.Author: lovelyr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel, one night post cruise, because of a Frommer recommendation. The hotel is located right on the Grand Canal 3 bridges from San Marco and has a water taxi entrance. The hotel had reserved a water taxi for us from the pier and when we got to the hotel the bellhop was at the door ready to take our luggage and addressed us by name. The rooms were ready within an hour of arrival which was about 11 o'clock. Each of the 4 couples had a different size room, even though we paid the same amount. All the rooms had different types of antique furniture. All the beds were kingsize and confortable . Bathrooms were large and modern with excellent amendities. There was a flat screen TV, safe and mini bar in the room. Robe and slippers were also provided. There was turn down service at night. Concierge was extremely helpful in arranging dinner for us in a non- tourist restaurant. He also gave us several suggestions for a days worth of touring Venice, Extremely pleasant and helpful. Wifi was $20.00 a day. Great breakfast buffet was included in the price. If you book more than 30 days in advance on line the price of the room is 15% less.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel to remember”
Reviews.Author: philimar
Reviews.Content: we stayed for five days at the metropole and are very happy to have done so. Nice and helpful service, professional staff, problem-solving director (he even tried to book us an entrance at san marco using his own credit card and made sure we didn't have to pay our internet access when it seemed not to work for us). The room (a junior suite) was comfortable and permanently checked-up (when we left after a short rest during the day everything was put in place and changed when we came back, it feeled we had a private butler). Perhaps one small detail but to us it matters: why ask for 8 euro at breakfast for a real orange juice? The rooms are not that cheap i suppose... we like our juice in the morning and got it in many other and simpler hotels... a detail to change i would like to think... Oh, before i forget... in the whole of venice we found no free wifi... even not at our hotel... we would like venice to grow onto the 21st century... Thanks and when we come back it will be at the Metropole! philip and sabine

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location - rude staff”
Reviews.Author: emichele22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, within a few blocks from San Marco square and right of the water bus lines making it easy to get to the hotel without having to hall luggage around. The room we stayed in was very nice. It had its own balcony with great views of the lagoon and canals of Venice. The bathroom was up to date and modern. The room was very spacious for European hotels, but could of used some updating. We used points to stay here, so I am not sure if it was worth the $500 a night pricetag that would have been the rate. Best thing about this hotel was location - could easily walk everywhere and for getting around, you can't beat being so close to the water bus lines. My only negative here would be the staff. When we checked in, they had two reservations for us. Clearly, we only made one reservation as we used up all of our points to make this reservation for two nights and didn't have any leftover, and we only called the reservation department once to make the reservation. Not sure why he would think we would deliberately make two?? However, he made it clear that he thought it was our fault and said it was a costly mistake for them. We did not get a very welcoming feeling from them and left to go check-into our room feeling awful...not a great way to make us feel on vacation. Other than that one experience with check-in and the gentleman being rude, the hotel is nice, clean and in one of the best spots in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: daniksta
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that I am used to staying at hotels which are run by large multinational chains like the four seasons/ mandarin oriental/ hyatt etc however I have stayed in some nice small boutique hotels, not that often though. The metropole in Venice was a little disappointing, I paid about 375 euros for a deluxe double bedroom in September which I think is the best price I could get for that time. Shortly after me and my fiancÃ© arrived I felt a little weary of the hotel staff, let me explain.... The room we were shown was absolutely tiny, it honestly was one of the smallest hotel rooms I had ever been in and I have stayed in tiny hotel rooms in Scandinavia/ norway which I thought were the smallest ever. We thought that no way was this a deluxe double and definitely not worth 370 euros. The view was the wall of another building and this wall was really close. We went down to the reception and asked if this was the deluxe double as we thought it was really small, the receptionist arrogantly exclaimed that " Everything in Venice is small as there is not enough space" and " yes the room was small.... but beautiful, just like Venice" however he went on to say that he could show us another room which might be bigger but not as "beautiful" . This room was much bigger and we had a view of the canal, we decided to move to that room. What was the motive behind this? I don't know, but the whole incident led me to believe that these guys were not very professional. Another incident , when we checked In, The same receptionist did a big sell on the hotels 2 star Michelin restaurant, he said it was excellent but we would have to be on a waiting list to eat there for the next three nights, unless... Oh wait a minute, , unless we went tonight. So we did.... We had the 11 course chefs surprise tasting menu which honestly was very average, our waitress however recommended us some excellent wines and surprise surprise the restaurant was pretty much empty! Another complaint , and I read this in another review, they gave us two single beds that were joined instead of a large queen sized or king sized bed. This was really irritating and I found myself sinking into the middle quite often, finally me and my partner had to squeeze in and sleep together on one side of the bed. I don't know why they don't sort this issue out. Breakfast was included but not close to being elaborate, any eggs or fresh juices were extra Ok so enough with the complaining, I guess you can't expect a lot from hotels in Venice, they know they can charge you a high price and not provide you with the best, also they can get away with run down mix match decor and most people will think it's quInt, romAntic and charming. To be fair , the service was otherwise suprisingly good and the receptionist was friendly and helped us out with whatever information we needed. The hotel had a nice courtyard with a bar and they served food there as well. The restaurant staff was extremely friendly and efficient, which We appreciated. For most people the metropole can be a cute quaint hotel in Venice but to the seasoned traveller who expects attention to detail and perfection in hospitality this hotel is very far from the mark. I wouldn't recommend it to any of my friends, perhaps I should have been prepared to pay a lot more and stayed in a better hotel in Venice . Oh and the Internet is only available on the lobby level of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but culd be improved in many ways”
Reviews.Author: BruniB
Reviews.Content: We were at the Metropole the day before we got on the Ruby Princess. We arrived and our room was not ready until 3pm. There is no internet in the rooms, we had to go down to the small lobby to get our e mail. To get to our room we had to go up a small elevator and then two small flight of stairs. The restaurant is supposed to be a ** Guide Michelin Restaurant, we made a reservation for 7 thirty and at nine when we complained because our main courses were not forthcoming, they apologized profusely but told us the chef would be starting our dish again as he had not put in some ingredient! We think the young waiters forgot to give our order in time, but we are not sure. Of course by then we walked out! When we left, next day we were asked to vacate our rooms by 11am. It is best not to stay in this hotel and look elsewhere for accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BenitoMadrid
Reviews.Content: My wife and me spent just one night there (we were spending pur holidays in Tuscany). The best is the situation, very close of San Marcos Square. We had dinner in its MET restaurant (2 ** Michelin Guide), it worth the effort, I recommend to ask for Surprise Menu, we started at 20:00 and finished at 0:00, about 15 wonderful plates and two bottles of wine. The room was big enough, no noise, even was a lagoon view, the only bad point was the breakfast, it was fine, but if you ask for an orange juice, they charge you 8 more â‚¬ (?), I would prefer to pay 8 more euros in the bill and have my orange juice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and would return, 2 thumbs up.”
Reviews.Author: jamann
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in Venice at this hotel. Everything was beautiful. The rooms were spacious and clean. Bathrooms were big with stand up shower and a tub. Great blowdryer. Breakfast had a good assortment of items. You could eat outside in the courtyard or in the hotel. Unless it was raining, I don't see why you wouldn't want to enjoy the beautiful courtyard. Small restaurant was very upscale. Location was centrally located near all the activity. The only downfall was distance from Train station. You could get a water taxi which is private and quick, but also costly (somewere around $70) You could take the ferry for a much smaller fee but longer ride. If you ask at the desk there are two boat runs that are much quicker from the hotel to the trainstation which is helpful your way out. There is also a travel agent a few doors down which was helpful in booking train tickets. They charge less than a 2% fee for their work. Well worht not having to stand in lines at the trainstation. If this hotel is in your budget I wouldn't hesitate on booking. As a side note, I didn't find any hotels in Italy that had a clock in the room. Time doesn't seem to matter much in Italy. As a cab driver in Rome said, "what we don't do today, will get to tomorrow".

Reviews.Title: “Metropole Hotel a journey back in time”
Reviews.Author: SteveWrenn
Reviews.Content: From the minute you arrive at the Metropole you know that you have begun a journey back in time in one of the most beautiful and tastefully decorated Hotels anywhere. The Hotel is decorated with antique furniture and paintings even the tables are wonderfully laid out with antique cutlery. You really don't mind paying a little of the odds at the bar when you can sit in luxury looking at the cruise ships passing bye and only for them you would easily think you were back in the 20s. The rooms in this hotel are absolutely stunning and every time you return to your room your bed has been made and your room tidied.The food served in the bar is excellent but the Michelin starred restaurant in the Hotel is without a doubt world class.The service is of the highest standard and the whole experience takes about 3 hours but you will enjoy every second of this truly amazing meal . Venice is a truly breath taking place and returning to the Metropole after a long day sightseeing just makes your stay all the more pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and friendly helpfull staff and a Venitian pace to serving”
Reviews.Author: Superfoil
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with welcoming and friendly helpful staff beautifull clean well decorated rooms. We had a 2 bedroom suite or apartment rates are not inexpensive, though venice specializes like other big tourist cites in high prices even for the ordinary, a coke at $6 is considered average and it's easy to pay more! The only down side I found at this hotel was the slow or non existent service if you wanted a drink in the hotels lounge you have to ask all the staff at least twice and should allow 2 hours if you want a cup of coffee or tea

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Laura222222
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropole Hotel for 4 nights, in a Junior suite with a view of the lagoon. The only major problem was the fact that they had a problem with the rezervations and when we arrived there were no double deluxe rooms with lagoon view available (that was what we had booked on the net and payed for), but they offered a better room with no extra charge. However we had to wait for it to be ready for about 3 hours. It was worth the wait, we had a great view of the lagoon, 3 large windows. All the rooms of the hotel are different from each other and we ended up with a great room. The staff was very helpful with all our requests and made us feel welcome (except for the incident with the room when we arrived). The breakfast was not great, not 5 stars in our oppinion, but the garden atmosphere made up for it and it was a real pleasure to go and have breakfast every morning. A great way to start the day! Take the water taxi if you are comming from the airport. It costs 100 euros and it's worth paying the extra money because the hotel has its own small pier and someone to great you and help with the bags. All in all, we had a wonderful stay in Venice and part of that was due to the Metropole Hotel. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, average value”
Reviews.Author: Hebros
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during a business trip. The building and the rooms are beautiful and stylish. The service is excellent. The weather was very hot and moist and the air conditioning system had some problems one of the nights so it was almost impossible to sleep. Cold breakfast is included in the price, but if you want some cooked eggs they will charge you for that additionally. Unfortunately we could not visit the restaurant as it was busy and we had not booked in advance. WiFi was available only in the lounge and with some interruptions.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rich55UK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully decorated and very stylish. Very expensive, but kind of worth it. Private Taxi from the airport was 100 euros. The room was large and airy, many antique items around the whole hotel. I would advise that only one night is needed in venice and just quickly blast around the whole town. When a coke and a beer can cost 15 euros you don't want to spend too ong in venice. If you want to treat yourself though the metropole is one of the best horels in venice. It also has a 2 star michelin restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Decadent. peaceful, restful”
Reviews.Author: PMwhf
Reviews.Content: This hotel delivers exactly what it promises - rooms, gardens, bar, lounge, breakfast all great. They have the only 2 michelin star restaurant in Venice. If you arrive by train or plane then you should aim to take a water taxi to the hotel. â‚¬60 from the train station and â‚¬100 from the Airport. The water bus from the airport will cost â‚¬13 to â‚¬30 depending on which line you get. The Gold line is slightly quicker than the Red line (about 50 mins V 70 mins). You can get the Gold line and get off at san Zaccaria which is right outside of the hotel (despite the hotel web site saying Arsenale is the nearest bus stop). Our guidebook map suggested that the walk way on the Grand Canal didnt cross the side canal on the blocj to the west of the hotel - it does! You will find peace and great service at this hotel PS - if you're planning to use the train out of Venice then make sure you pre book. The trains are heavily subsidised and hence very popular

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AbhishekG_Mumbai
Reviews.Content: The outstanding restaurant two Michelin stars in 2010, is the best of Venice and maybe Italy ...We chose this hotel compared to other 5 star hotels in Venice just for his restaurant. The buffet breakfast extremely rich and varied, included in the price of the room while in other hotels of Venice is a supplement to the unreasonable pricing (100 â‚¬ for 2 at Bauer! Whatever its composition, is a breakfast, so do not exaggerate). Great location and excellent value for money. the charm of the place and very elaborate decorations throughout the hotel, kind staff, The family suite has one bathroom and lighting of the hotel is a little inadequate for our tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute bliss”
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after an 8 hour flight from Toronto. You must drag your bags for a good seven to ten minutes to the dock. Your choices are a waterbus (11 euro) or watertaxi (110 euro). Water taxi takes about 20 minutes right to your hotel dock. The waterbus takes 70 minutes . The waterbus stops near St Marco and you must drag your bags to your hotel. Crazy. Thru the main square and hoards of people and down tiny little alley streets packed with tourists. SPLURGE. Take the taxi - we did on the return and loved it-money well spent. Hotel is right beside a small bridge over a secondary canal -gondoliers go right by - so nice!. Very freindly staff and our room was AMAZING. A room for our suitcases, my daughts room was a flip-out couch with a dresser, fridge, flat screen TV-VCR and floor to ceiling window. Our room adjoined with a pocket door and was huge -king bed, flat sceen TV, dresser, beautiful drapes. The bathroom was also huge - 2 sinks, bidet, top of the line shower with whirlpool, huge windows overlooking the canal and marble, marble, marble. Spotless maid service, candies on the pillow at nite and towels refreshed during the day. Breakfast was fine -mostly continental with sliced meats and cheeses with some scrambled eggs and bacon. Coffee was hot and strong. We actually hated to leave this hotel. We were 2 nites in Venice then off to Rome -you really need more than 2 nites at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A step back in time, with all modern amenities!”
Reviews.Author: seeker21
Reviews.Content: As you enter the hotel the atmosphere exudes luxury and timelessness! It is as if you have stepped back into more gracious times. Wonderful staff and a beautiful junior suite overlooking the Canal. The small bar is intimate and cosy - the whole hotel "glistens". Everywhere you look are antiques and special objects. Then of course is the location - could not be better. St Marks Square only minutes away. Dont miss this one!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel the Metropole is.........”
Reviews.Author: 123baker
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a fab stay at the Metropole. We stayed in room 403 with a private roof terrace which I can thoroughly recommend. We have been to Venice 6 times and this is by far the best hotel/room we have stayed in. After booking we looked at the reviews on this site and was feeling a little uneasy with some of the reviews of the staff. After staying at the Metropole I ask myself were these people staying at the same hotel as me. From the moment the door to the hotel opened from the water taxi the staff were impeccable. Whenever you saw a member of staff they acknowledged you and were always smiling. The ladies who run breakfast were so lovely and friendly. The breakfast itself was very enjoyable and plentiful. We did think the chambermaids may have been spying on us as everytime we used any towels or toilettries they were replenished as soon as we left the room ! The room was very clean and the airconditioning a relief on what was a hot 4 night stay. The room was silent and we slept soundly every night - there was never any noise whatsoever. To get up in the morning and sit on the roof terrace watching the cruise ships and tourists arrive for the day before breakfast was a great start to the day. The reception staff were always interested in our travels and were very friendly. On departure before we paid the bill they checked everything had been as we expected and that we were totally happy before presenting the bill. Yes, it is expensive, but quality in Venice costs money and we were more than happy. The only problem now is we don't want to go back to Venice unless it is to room 403 at the Metropole!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with personality”
Reviews.Author: earlycheckin
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from an excellent weekend in Venice with my partner. We took a water taxi from the airport direct to the hotelâ€™s private dock. This was a memorable experience and the perfect start to our break; it was expensive, but it was worth every penny. On arrival at the Metropole the reception staff were welcoming and friendly. Our room was brilliant. Each room in the hotel has a different theme, ours had Chinese theme. Superb silk panelling on the walls. We also had a small terrace with views of the canal and over the lagoon. Breakfast was served in the garden. This was a real treat in the centre of the city. The selection was impressive, and the quality of product was first class. Special mention to the breakfast staff who were attentive, friendly and funny. It was the ideal start to the day. Location-wise the hotel is well located a short walk from St Markâ€™s Square. The hotel probably isnâ€™t for those who like their hotels corporate and sterile. There is bags of character and the standard of service make it worth everyone of itâ€™s five stars. If you like pretentious rude service donâ€™t stay here. If, however, you enjoy efficient, friendly service where the staff have personality and actually remember your name then this is the place for you! We shall definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou for the most amazing weekend!”
Reviews.Author: pandaroll
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the most amazing weekend in Venice after staying at the Metropole hotel. Our suite was on the top floor looking out across the Grand Canal which provided the most amazing views. As someone who normally likes a minimalistic contemporary atmosphere this hotel most definately took me outside of my comfort zone which was immediately apparant from walking into the opulant foyer. However I could not help but marvel at the decor throughout the hotel. Indeed I even wandered the corridors of the hotel in order to take in the various displays as one would within a musuem. This was to be a special weekend for us as I had arranged the trip to propose to my girlfriend and was not disappointed in anyway. Before arriving I had corresponded with Enzo from the concierge in order to arrange a number of plans and surprises throughout the weekend, all the staff ensured that we were not disappointed and made the stay delightful. The breakfasts in the morning were relaxed with a fantastic selection of fresh food and brilliant service. We ate in the Met Restaurant within the hotel which was a wonderful experience and I have posted a seperate review of that evening. We both felt sad when it came to leave Venice and would return quite happily and without a doubt stay at this hotel again. And for those who are wondering, my girlfriend said yes!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, go for a suite but no high expectation, it's Venice...”
Reviews.Author: oliviercale
Reviews.Content: Love the location, less industrial American or Japanese crowd than the Bauer or Danieli... We were lucky and got nice Arabian nights suite facing the grand canal , with royal bathtub, hammam etc... The again, they have long lost sense of quality of service with the mass-toursim in Venice...so don't expect too much and take it as a nice base to explore further nice bars & restaurants...

Reviews.Title: “eh”
Reviews.Author: ginatufano
Reviews.Content: worst hotel of our two week italy trip. small, worn rooms and inoperable AC made us hate being in our room. The breakfast was nice tho - really liked the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bgetze
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my 4th stay at the Metropole. Great location and a beautiful hotel. The rooms are always interesting (check out the Angel Suite), the bar is very welcoming and the breakfast staff a pleasure. Don't let the nasty bald man at reception turn you off. All the other reception members are great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, perfect location....can't say enough good things about it.”
Reviews.Author: leadhitter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had this hotel booked as a pre-night before a cruise. Your water taxi pulls you right up to it so no bridge/luggage drama was had. Got there at 10 am, check-in was 2 pm. They held our bags but room was ready at 12:00pm. Awesome. Our room, 209, was one of the few that had a balcony. It overlooked the canal to the left, and the lagoon to the right. We though it was wonderful. The location, right on the lagoon was perfect as it was only a 10 minute walk to St. Marks, and was easy to find. When roaming the streets at night, I know as long as I was heading South I was okay. My favorite thing about this hotel though was the staff. They were outstanding to deal with. If I get back there, I won't hesitate to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “near St Marcs place ... so what ?”
Reviews.Author: jr_hummel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 5 days at the Metropole. We had booked a classic room (#243) which had one window overlooking the garden. The room was of decent size but the poor lighting, antique style furniture with "antique" wall paper (it really deserves changing !) and little light coming through the window were somewhat depressing. This is not a room where you want to spend time so reserve in the Spring & autumn. The service was mixed: reception and breakfast personnel were very helpful & friendly however the 1 star Michelin restaurant (the Met) was a catastrophy ! We had decided to have dinner there the day of our arrival but our 20:00 request was turned down so we chose 21:00 (perhaps there are 2 services ?). In any case, tired but looking forward to a delicious meal we walked down at 21:10. After ordering we waited until ... 22:15 to get an appetizer ! meal started being served at 22:45 but unfortunately this was "creative" cuisine. The goose liver served on monk fish is non-sense as the fish could not be tasted with the strong goose liver taste, which itself normally served cold had turned luke warm from sitting on the fish. Most dishes were barely touched but no-one seemed to care, either the young waiters and waitresses or the Chef. And to think that I had chosen this hotel for its' restaurant ! So yes current TripAdvisor rating of #78 out of 454 Venice hotels does make some sense. The hotel is expensive for what it offers but so is everything else in Venice. Best eating experience was the Madonna trattoria 200 feet away from the Rialto bridge (train station side, first alley perpendicular to the canal) for traditional italian food and a nice outdoor experience at the Cips' - the terrasse restaurant of the Cipriani Palace hotel across the lagoon on the Giudecca island facing St Marc place and offering a no charge 15' boat ride from St Marcs boat harbour. Nice food and a very romantic nightly experience. A must for those who have the time: a 1 hour boat ride to Burano where lace is a speciality and a beautiful and colorful fishermans island. In net: Venice remains a must and staying in the Center is ideal, but not necessarily off St Marcs place.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but”
Reviews.Author: rkjsunrise
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend and was really unimpressed with the service. The hotel is in a great situation and the room ok but was shocked by the attitude of the reception staff who had obviously had a long season and were very unwelcoming. Jaded and arrogant might sum up their attitude to clients. A captive market means that a 4 star hotel such as the Metropole does not need to bother with customer service.we felt we were imposing in their busy lives. Having said that, the staff in the breakfast restaurant were pleasant and polite

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, comfy, convenient a little quirky and a good deal”
Reviews.Author: jharrisfosf
Reviews.Content: Metropole was a great homebase for Venice - only 5 minutes or less off of St Marks Square and right on the main strip - but not too noisy - and great service - concierge was excellent - funky decor but comfy and a cool restaurant - again a bit avante garde and a little pricey. Our only complaint was a loud neighbor in the room next door - but the second night was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Historical beauty with a modern accent”
Reviews.Author: vinosanto
Reviews.Content: We had two nights in Venice at the Metropole Hotel, perfect location, on the water, the view is amazing, the restaurant, fantastic, a perfect place for a cafe or romantic dinner overlooking a beautiful city. The rooms are well done with opulent venetian beds, curtains and modern bathroom in white marble. We were pleasantly surprised with Metropole and will recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and underserviced hotel with position as only redeeming feature”
Reviews.Author: JSJJMelbourne
Reviews.Content: After check in arrived in room to find 2 cigarette butts on the floor. Room O.K for Venice standards but 3 star on international standards. We found the velour and red quite tacky. Bathroom average standard but I doubt you could ever really revamp it. Lobby and lounge area smelt of really cheap incense as if they were attempting to cover up some other worse smell. Breakfast was poor, a cold buffet only. The woman seating people was rude and made us feel like we were lucky to even get a table. No staff spoke to us throughout the stay ( lucky it was only 2 days) except when we were leaving and they had to rush through the credit card while the taxi was waiting. My son was rudely told off by staff for sitting on the step by the water taxi deck while waiting. My husband and other son meanwhile were dragging all the cases on their own while the staff looked on. Being 14 and 12 my boys thought the experience quite amusing in a Faulty Towers kind of way. It was dark and dinghy not cosy. From memory I think we paid 450 Euros a night for this treatment. Would have had more fun pouring Moet into the Lagoon

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, best we've ever had in VENICE”
Reviews.Author: Racer356
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights in early May,2009. Booked a Jr.Suite under a promotion that the hotel had - four nights for price of three --. Great hotel, excellent service, spotlessly clean rooms. We asked for a quiet room, and that is what we got. No spectacular view ( we knew that when we asked for the quiet room) but a simple view out the side of the hotel. Very nice breakfast included, internet available for a small fee in the lobby. We were very pleased with the hotel, the service of the staff, the location, and all the amenities.Direct access to the hotel by water taxi from the airport makes arrival just that much more pleasant after a long journey.The jr.suite was very spacious and quite comfortable. Nice modern bathroom. . We did not try the restaurant, as it seemed pretty pricey ( it is a Michelin starred restaurant) but it looked quite nice -- but not too busy!. Reflecting the global economy, everything seemed quite quiet around Venice. All around a great value,considering this is an upscale ( not economy) hotel and the best we have ever had in Venice. (we have been to Venice many times over the last 25 years). Next time in Venice we will stay at this hotel in a heartbeat!,

Reviews.Title: “A great location, easy to find hotel - with a charming old-world style.”
Reviews.Author: nick164
Reviews.Content: Pros: - location (5-10 mins walk to San Marco Sq, and right on the waterfront) - lovely old world charm, and interesting curious throughout the hotel - the tranquil courtyard for breakfast Cons: - the standard bedroom was a bit small, and the bed was not a double but in fact two singles made-up as a double. The room was however nicely furnished in period style (excluding the LCD tv) - although the hotel is on the lagoon, the bar and restaurant don't have a great outlook (due to small windows) and the lobby area is rather dark. Tip - if you're taking the waterbus from the airport to the hotel (as the "timetables" don't always run as advertised), it's worth bearing in mind in addition to Arsenale (the stop recommended by the hotel) the hotel is also only a few mins walk from San Zaccreia. It's just under 10 mins walk from San Marco, but there are a few more bridges to traverse carrying your case.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been happier with our choice...”
Reviews.Author: Essex_EnglandTeresa
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at The Metropole Hotel in late August 2008. We booked this accommodation as a late booking and could not have been happier with our choice. It is an ideal spot on the very edge of Venice - - literally a few steps away from where all the boats stop and just a short walk away from San Marco. We did much travelling in our 3 short days and when we returned from our journeys it was wonderful to be so close to the hotel. The hotel is beautiful inside and quite grand in Venetian style. Our room seemed huge in size even though we are a family of 2 adults and 2 children. There was ample storage space for all of us and we had a side sea view out onto the lagoon where you could see and hear all the boats arriving. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis. Breakfasts were taken in the courtyard each morning and of typical continental style with croissants, fruits, cereals etc. - - - all plentiful plus you could order a hot breakfast if required. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Metropole and felt if we ever returned to Venice again then a stay at the Metropole is a must!

Reviews.Title: “First Rate”
Reviews.Author: Gfuss
Reviews.Content: I am just returning home from my first visit to Venice and as part of my overall Old World experience I feel compelled to write a â€˜little somethingâ€™ to express appreciation for the wonderful time I spent at the Hotel Metropole last week. My first impression of the Hotel was its grand archetypal and artistic style, with rare classic art collections throughout the grounds. In my humble opinion, this striking first impression was also on par with the professionalism I received at the front desk, upon check in, being ushered to my suite and throughout my two night stay. My accommodations were charming and very clean to say the least. Added to that, I specifically loved the exclusivity of each room and also the courteous manner in which I was dealt with by the Assistant Manager and his staff. My only criticism would be for those in the front desk to at least give the guests a headâ€™s -up on what to expect once they are offering the free water-taxi ride from the hotel to the glass factory in Isla Murano. Sometimes the glass sales representatives may get very pushy and this can detract from a wonderful tme. This hotel I would recommend to anyone needing basic information in the future. Graham Dawson

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: ebthecat
Reviews.Content: Venice is clearly a ridiculously expensive city so was pleased to find the Hotel Metropole. It is situated close to the main Square but far enough not to be affected by the noise. The interior of the hotel is fantastic, lush and everything you would want and expect from an Italian hotel. The rooms were very nice, each individually decorated. The bathrooms were fine, no complaints and breakfast was decent too. The lounge area looked v inviting and the bar equally so though we did not avail ourselves of those facilities. My only disappointment was the meal in the Michelin star restaurant - it was very pretentious. It was a little irritating being presented with a 4 page water menu at the start of the meal that had lots of chemical symbols but absolutely no description to help the uninitiated choose the right bottle! Not a good start to the meal. I consider myself quite an unfussy and adventurous eater but I found it very hard to find something I wanted to eat for any/all of the courses.
