Whilst I cannot rave about the restuarant, the hotel overall was excellent - the staff curteous and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice. I would not recommend however the tour to the glass factory which was offered by the hotel free of charge. Whilst the taxi trip to the factory was obviously a treat, the factory was a disappointment, found the majority of the glass plain ugly and we had a quite horrible salesman who was pushy, bordering on plain rude, shadowing our every step through each room. It was not pleasant and not something the hotel needs to associate itself with.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Si_Mealor
Reviews.Content: It's been a long time since I went to the Metropole (July last year), but have been to a number of hotels since and none of them have lived up to the magnificent Metropole. A minor booking mix-up over card details was smoothed over by Mr Aurelio Bon with a lovely bottle of Prosecco. The room - junior suite - was fantastic, the garden breakfast, simply a delight, with sparrows flying round pecking crumbs. Some highlights: tea and biscuits listening to chill-out music and thumbing through old copies of the Michelin guide to France, the enormous bathroom, looking out at the lagoon as a mighty storm blew through the passage between our room and Vivaldi's church, the sound of foghorns in the night, and sinking into the lovely sofa watching the tour de france on television, while quaffing cocktails. A marvellous Hotel of utter style and relaxation, very high class.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel for a true Venetian experience!”
Reviews.Author: poogleypie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first trip to Venice, in a Junior Suite. We arrived by water taxi and check in was very efficient and welcoming. The hotel is small but not tiny, with lots of beautiful features throughout - great collections of antique fans and art displayed everywhere. They gave us a fruit basket in our room on arrival. The room itself was large and stunning, with an elevated four poster bed and angels on the ceiling. Perhaps over the top in any other city, but just perfect in Venice. We had two windows - one which looked out over the canal, and one over the courtyard. The bathroom window also looked out over the canal. The bathroom had a dressing room attached which was nice, although very narrow (can't fit two people at once). The bathroom itself was on the small side compared to the bedroom, but it had a separate bath and shower and lovely Gilchrest and Soames bath products. Breakfast was included in our rate and was served in a breakfast room facing the courtyard. This was a bit dark and not as nice as the rest of the hotel (probably nicer in summer when you can eat in the courtyard I assume) but the service was friendly and the food was simple and good. The hotel bar was a perfect and lovely place to recuperate after a day of sightseeing - looking out over the lagoon, very warm and cozy with great snacks. Overall, we had a wonderful romantic stay at this hotel and would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: RedSavage
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room and qualified for a promotional upgrade to a Junior Suite. When I checked in with my husband, we were given a wonderful full suite. The service was warm and we were extremely pleased with our experience.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel - an experience to be enjoyed!”
Reviews.Author: KipperGlosUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropole 25 years ago on our honeymoon - promising to return for our 25th wedding anniversary. We are so glad made this decision. We tried to book our original room, but the hotel could not work out which it was, but when they heard why, they upgraded us to a room with a lagoon view and balcony - as well serving us "champagne" and silver almonds on arrival. The hotel is outstandingly decorated, we felt it was like walking into a romantic by-gone age, so right for our honeymoon and 25 years later for our wedding anniversary. The hotel is quite pricey - as we are both now retired (early, I quickly add) we, unfortunately, agreed that we could not afford to eat in the MET restaurant, but the menu looked delicious and the aroma from the kitchen was wonderful. Just a little hint - do not be fooled into thinking that the water and nuts are complimentary - they are not! Breakfast is a real feast - cereals, bowls of fruit, yogurts, little puddings (Tirimisu for breakfast WOW!), croissants, pastries, cakes, breads, cooked meat selection, cheese selection, salad - I could go on! I know I ate too much, but what a wonderful start to the day. We were a bit naughty - we knew there were no tea/coffee making facilities, so we took our own, so useful for that early morning drink before breakfast. We can not fault the service at all - the room was attended to continually during the day, exceptionally clean, and the staff were friendly, helpful and informative. We just want to say thankyou to the staff at the Metropole for helping us to make our "2nd honeymoon" in Venice so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “so disappointed”
Reviews.Author: tannenj
Reviews.Content: We were really prepared to love the Metropole. We had reserved 2 rooms, had requested them to be connecting as we were traveling with our 17 yr old grand daughter. We got non-connecting rooms and non-adjacent on the first floor with no view. The rooms were shabby. the wall paper in my g-daughter's room was torn in places. The night noise was more than annoying. For some reason from my gdaughter's room you could hear bathroom noises from other rooms . In our room, the bathroom floor was filthy and when I had used a bath towel, noticed too late that a blood stain had not fully been removed when the towel had been washed. Even a 2 star hotel knows when to discard used old towels.

Reviews.Title: “Escape from the crowds!”
Reviews.Author: travellingred
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights in the middle of a three month tour of Italy and some of Europe. After the disappointments of a few much more expensive hotels this was a joy. The room was excellent with a lovely view over one of the canals down into the Grand canal and the staff were superb - friendly and helpful. We particularly enjoyed relaxing in the garden area and late at night in the bar. The food is the restaurant worthy of its reputation and the service delivered by friendly staff. The location is superb. All in all we would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful and wonderful choice for a Christmas holiday break - just bring your umbrella!”
Reviews.Author: tansyliverwort
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 7 or 8 nights at the Metropole over Christmas 2008. We were absolutely delighted with our room, and the accomodation in the hotel. We found the staff consistently helpful when asked. There restaurant recommendations (from someplace very fancy for Christmas eve and Christmas day dinner....to a very simply neighborhood place to get some fresh fish) were right on the mark. I have one complaint, and one complaint only... and that was during a period when Venice was expected much rain and flooding, when we needed an umbrella we had to purchase one from the hotel -- that was surprising to us from a hotel of this caliber. Putting that aside, we will likely return to the Metropole for our next stay in Venice. Oh - almost forgot... internet connections only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Metropole!”
Reviews.Author: blinkofani
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed only 1 night in Venice. We found the Metropole online at hotels.com. We wanted a room with a view or balcony and we managed to find 1 room (one of the junior suites) at the Metropole with a nice little balcony view overlooking the Rio della Pieta. The junior suites are all decorated differently and we loved ours the most (we had a chance to see a few other available rooms). The hotel was small yet beautiful and has a luxurious feel with rich colors and gorgeous decor. It is decorated with elegant antiques.The all-you-can-eat breakfast was amazing! We had the choice to grab as much food as we wanted and they hotel staff brought it up to our room on a cart (because we had so much food!). Our room was gorgeous. It had a beautiful bathroom with skylights, a flat screen tv, stereo, sitting area, and a large bed. Everything was top notch quality, with many fine details. We fell in love with this hotel and would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Nes1745
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, people are very nice and helpful, professional. Rooms are very nice and clean. Excelent location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Motorbikefella
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metropole in November 2008 for 8 nights and found it a great place to stay. For the first night we had a room without much of a city view but were changed without question to a higher city-view room at no charge. Good basic restraunt - with great Vietnamese style coffee - and a buffet breakfast with variety. The refurbished rooms would be 4 1/2 star back home. It is an interesting 10 minute walk to town centre, but a walk in any direction will find things of interest to a traveler. We mostly walked the city but there are taxi's out-front and attentive staff that were happy to help. All up a great stay and would recommend to give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Humphrey_Wright
Reviews.Content: This is an incredible hotel on the Riva degli Schiavoni. It is approximately 200 meters from St Marks Square but far enough away to be quiet. It is a "funky" place with loads of antiques all over the hotel. The staff were extremely helpful. The buffet breakfast was the best we have ever had and the prices, for Venice, were most reasonable - provided that you did not want a room overlooking the St Marks basin. Whenever we visit Venice in future this will be our first choice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel in a beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: Janet K
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights there while in Venice for my boyfriend's birthday. It was worth every Euro we paid for it even though the exchange rate is not in our favor. The decor is amazing and you can spend hours looking through the collections throughout the hotel. Our room was amazing. We had a lagoon view which was magical as well as a beautiful tiled tub which was a wonderful place to relax after a day of sight seeing. We had drinks in the bar both nights and the staff there was fantastic. The location is ideal as it is just off of St. Mark's Square. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to venice.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mllto
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed here in July. The hotel is beautiful, centrally located and the service is 5 star. Breakfast is incl. in the price of the room.... the breakfast is excellent as well. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to start your Italian Vacation”
Reviews.Author: aaacitelli
Reviews.Content: Our almost 3-week trip to Italy began in Venice and we couldn't have asked for a better introduction. Our family of five plus our friends who are our children's god-parents stayed for 3 nights in June. As we were traveling with 3 children ages 7, 9 and almost 13, our room was quite large. It consisted of two king beds (Twins pulled together as one unit, just stay on your side and it was just fine) plus an additional twin that looked like a princesses bed (our daughter loved it!) As a plane delay and then connection loss caused our arrival to be extremely late,we simply text messaged the hotel to inform them then took a private water taxi to the hotel from the airport ($95 euros). It was worth every penny as it taxi'd us to the side water entrance of the hotel and the ride from the airport was just beautiful at night! Although the beds were very firm, we found out that it appears to be a preference in Italy no matter where you stayed to have very firm mattresses. The fact that the hotel is so old and at one point was an orphange where Vivaldi would give lessons to the girls, just added to its mystique and charm. The rooms were very clean and out friend's was just lovely as well and just what you would expect in an old, historical hotel. Our only complaint which we were forwarned in other posting was that the trip to Murano which taxis for free from the hotel to a factory is pretty high pressure and was told that the return ride was complimentary only with a purchase, and incidentally, the prices are fantastically high (it is not the only one on the island by the way and you have to exit it and ask how to leave it otherwise they will just put you back on the water taxi as if nothing else but that one factory exists) so I would just take a general public transport to Murano and save the hassle. Murano is worth seeing and the little shops and food bistros are quite good. That would be my only complaint...the fact that the consierge which advises you to go by their own private boat but does not tell you about the high pressure sales and cost of return, plus the fact that you have to personally ask how to get out of the factory so that you can explore Murano. I will say that after seeing all of the other hotels in Venice and on the Grand Canal etc., there isn't one that I thought "wish we stayed there". In fact, I would absolutely stay at the Hotel Metropole again as the location is perfect, scenic, incredibly easy to dind you way home and a delight.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!!!”
Reviews.Author: JamesKel
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was amazing!!! Relaxing, Romantic, Beautiful, Great service!!! Wonderful breakfast in a beautiful setting. Some mornings we ate outside in the intimate internal garden. Venice is such a magic city and coming back to our hotel completed our experience. Listening the boats passing in front of the hotel was so relaxing!! It is only a 5 minute walk to Piazza San Marco. Our Room was amazing! A huge bed and nice bathroom with every modern amenity. The hotel restaurant, Met, is worth a trip by itself! I can't wait to stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: emgtraveller
Reviews.Content: great location. very convenient. great room with two beds since we were travelling with a college age child. clean and comfortable. freindly. not too far from an internet cafe. breakfast was fine. wouldn't go to venice in the summer again, but would think about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “exellent superb”
Reviews.Author: thetravellerEssex
Reviews.Content: stayed at the metropole in march 08... the location is superb easy walking distance st marks square rialto bridge etc .. the hotel itself is superb the decoration and attention to detail is excellent.. the staff are very polite helpfull and courteous.. you must try the tasting menu at the met restaurant although a little expensieve at Â£100 per person believe me it is well worth it the food and wine you get is top class, perfect for that special occasion..

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Olde Worlde Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: BlueWilz1
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Venice and enjoyed our stay at the Metropole Hotel immensley. The Old World charm gave it a very comfortable feel with out being too over the top. The staff were very helpful and fluent in English which was also a great help to us and they gave us some great ideas of what to do and where to visit whilst in Venice. We would recommend the hotel to other travellers and would indeed look forward to staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Metropole's staff helps to make your dreams come true, communicate directly.”
Reviews.Author: PAlovesItaly
Reviews.Content: There is no other staff in all of Italy that is as capable, professional and gracious. They are the very, very best staff. Just as in America, when considering property, one looks at location, location, location. The Metropole has all the shopping, water transportation and historic centre at its doorstep on the Rive degli Schiavoni. You don't want to be on a crowded water taxi for an hour three times a day, commuting to a new destination. In Venice you can waste hours you do not have going to a destination. Get close and make the most of your valuable time. Get the white, plastic covered DK book on Venice, study the map and history before you get there and plan your days carefully. Get a room overlooking the side canal or basin if you can afford the additional cost. A stay at the Metropole is unforgettable. Venice is enchanting, magical like no other city in the world because of the water, beauty and history. My family and I will retain many memories of the Hotel, the staff and the city for all our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: Staffycher
Reviews.Content: Actually stayed here for our honeymoon a couple of years back but decided to check out the reviews out of nostalgic yearning. I am absolutely astonished by the bad reviews as our stay was perfect and magical inevery way. We had the most outstanding room I have ever stayed in, the staff were fantastic and the food wonderful. Absolute charm personified. I decided to post this review in defence of the hotel and the staff and state categorically that if I was to stay in Venice again this hotel would be my number one choice. Don't be put off.

Reviews.Title: “A bad suprise”
Reviews.Author: samarra
Reviews.Content: When I first saw the hotel on tripadvisor, I was incredibly happy and very excited. I remember saying how lovely the pictures looked and how much I looked forward to staying at the Metropole. However, I was very much disappointed once I saw the hotel. Indeed the entrance is grand with the red carpet and great ornaments but the room was very disappointing. It was small and cramped. The bed was a total joke! It was not a double bed but two single beds pushed together with a gap in the middle. I found myself sleeping in the gap every night just so I could be near my husband. The irritation this caused was immense. On top of all this the air conditioning did not work and the control system for it was far too complicated. I feared to ask the staff as I found them not at all useful from when asking them questions on other occasions and quite frankly they were cold and somewhat rude. The bathroom was nice with the heated flooring but lacked ventilation, which it really does need. The television, even though not so important when on holiday, caused much annoyance and boredom as it only had two English speaking channels which happened to be CNN and Eurosports; never have I been so clued up with world news! I did not eat at the hotel restaurant mainly due to it being so overpriced but breakfast was nice. I enjoyed the croissants and tea. However, I think the hotel could have offered a hot breakfast as well- basically not worth the money! The location is fantastic as you are close to everything. The view is beautiful, especially if you have a bedroom facing the water but we did not have that. Overall, it was a great disappointment and I found the whole trip looking into other hotels and wondering why I had spent so much money staying at the Metropole.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Metropole stay clear!!!”
Reviews.Author: Worldtravelled8
Reviews.Content: We went for New Year's and a few days in January to our incredibly disappointment due to substandard conditions! The hotel staff has no concept of customer service and the hotel is overpriced and definitely not worth a repeat visit. It is rare that we feel that we have been robbed by a hotel. The many issues included booking (and paying) for a double bed only to find two beds pushed together which were quite uncomfortable. When we mentioned we had paid for a double room, the front desk took the attitude: "tough luck." We also splurged on the New Year's Eve dinner. The hotel allegedly has a one star michelin chef.. at a price tag of $1500 for two we were shocked that the food was barely edible. Again, hotel staff never bothered to ask why the plates were cleared and the dishes hardly eaten. When we mentioned the bad experience again the reaction was "tough luck". Finally the hotel brochure displays lovely and spacious rooms however, the advertising is largely false, the rooms are small, and not in good condition or properly cleaned. Although we did not use the bidet, their were hairs (not ours!!) for all three days we stayed in the hotel. Stay clear of this hotel, for this whopping price, you could do a lot better than Metropole!

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Metropole!”
Reviews.Author: JChua
Reviews.Content: After spending a great deal of time researching on hotels facing the Basin of San Marco, finally picked the Hotel Metropole due to its uniqueness. Through various emails with Alessandro and Vio, finally picked a special Deluxe room with Lagoon view, room 403. Many thanks to Alessandro for the tip, cheers! Upon checking in, we were shown the other unique Deluxe rooms, room 401 and 409. Room 401, like room 403, has a square shaped terrace facing the Lagoon and the San Giorgio Island but its views were somewhat blocked as it is located right behind room 403. On the other hand, room 409 has the best unblocked view of the Lagoon to the front as well as the whole Riva degli Schiavoni to its right and to its left (the Salute Church and all!). But, why didn''t we pick room 409 instead? The reason - it does not have a terrace with chairs and table like rooms 401 and 403, it only has a small standing room only balcony! Once in our room 403, we were happy to find the cosy, tailor made L-shaped sofa, huge sized flat screen Hitachi TV, nicely designed bed, orange-white colour theme but most of all, the stunning views of the San Giorgio Maggiore Island its terrace offers!!! This is the view I loved most in all of Venice, to me, it is the most iconic symbol of Venice. I have dreamt of celebrating our wedding anniversary on the special terrace, drinking champagne in view of the Lagoon! And this dream had finally come true ....thanks to the Hotel Metropole! What I liked most about the Metropole is, its manager, staff are all ultra friendly and helpful, even though we were only staying for one night. That does'nt seem to bother them, as they had even sent us a complimentaly bottle of chilled Possecco (right spelling?) and chocolates! What a thougtful thing to do, how sweet of them ... Moreover, its room rates, accommodation quality, location, yummy breakfasts, cosy secret garden are also hard to beat along this stretch of Riva degli Schiavoni. (Of course, there are more luxurious choices like the Luna Baglioni which I had stayed in April this year but it also charged considerably more for its Lagoon facing Junior suite, minus a terrace ...). Oh yes, room 403 is especially quiet for a good night's sleep, important for jet lagged visitors like us! Lastly, for the minor negatives. I had found the bed a tad too small, there was no shower in the bathhroom and the toiletries offered were very very limited, food in its Michelin starred Met Restaurant leaves much to be desired ....But I am not really bothered by these small things. Given the chance, we would go back to stay at the Metropole's room 403 in a heartbeat. The next time, wish we could stay a little longer, with such a big terrace and superb views across the Lagoon, one could easily stay in such a room for a week or two. After checking out of the Metropole, we stayed another night at the brand new, Ca Sagredo Hotel in the Canneregio section of Venice. (do see my other review).

Reviews.Title: “A treat for all senses”
Reviews.Author: Angspar
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Venice airport, I checked my water taxi reservation and noted the taxi would drop us off at the â€˜nearest dock to your hotelâ€™. I asked the representative how far the my hotel was from the dock. She laughed and said â€˜Madam, you are staying at the Metropoleâ€™. I didnâ€™t press her any further and 25 minutes later when we pulled up to the front door of the Metropole and the doorman helped me depart the boat, I understood what she meant. The Metropole is a throw back to a more elegant and formal time. The front desk area is decorated in reds, dark wods and silver trays. The lobby is well appointed with comfortable couches and dark wood tables (antiques). Additionally, glass cases contain many collections of evening bags, religious items and cork screws. They were all beautiful and interesting to look at. The hotels garden is luxurious,too. The fabric covered gazebo has comfortable upholstered couches and is heated as well. The garden is walled and gives the feeling of a hidden sanctuary. At night , candles are placed throughout making it very romantic. It was the little touches that my group appreciated the most. The divided silver trays had instead of pot pourri had many types of spices. They enjoyed the layering effect of the different objects in the room, combining natural items with objects of art. The day we were checking in the Metropole began decorating for Christmas. It was a real treat to see how their decorator combined things from nature (shells, coral, moss, greens) with lights and art. The Christmas decorations were icing on a beautiful cake. I had read in a previous review the Metropole staff was not friendly. I would counter the Metropole staff is professional and courteous in a warm but formal way. I was never addressed by my name, but Madam. Requests were handled quickly and without incident. The Metropole staff was clearly there to do a job and they did it with grace and elegance. . Our room overlooked the garden. The king sized bedroom featured a large armoire with a safe and dresser built in. There was also a good sized dresser.We had comforable chairs and a table. The bathroom featured a marble counter top and beautiful tile. I really appreciated the lighted magnifying mirror. (I will post photos at a later date). If you are looking for a hotel that embraces the feeling and atmosphere of Venice itself, the Metropole is for you.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel stay out of the 15 days we were in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: EbethDallas
Reviews.Content: The Metropole was the perfect place to stay while in Venice. We got a discount on the room from a website and expected to stay in a lesser room. If this was the lesser room, then I would hate to see the luxury suite. The rooms were clean and had everything you could need to pamper yourself. The only semi interesting thing about the hotel was the fact that there was only a bath, no shower in our room, but who cares! We had a straircase in the room that led to our private balcony where there was a small alley of water on one side, looked out over the water on another side, and showed the rooftops of Venice on the other side. The sitting area had a large plasma television and a remote control sunroof. We took the waterbus to the hotel's stop and the hotel was only a 2 minute walk away. The main square (San Marcos) is right there too. They couldn't let us into our room when we first arrived because we were too early, but they did hold our bags. The breakfast buffet had a lot of variety but lacked the typical eggs and bacon. I strongly recommend staying in this hotel, especially if you can get a deal for it. There were several hotels in the tiny winding streets of Venice, but I was glad we stayed at the Metropole which was so easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: SteveALondon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I selected the Metropole from a selection given by our travel agent - we stayed for 7 nights. Having their own jetty is a real plus and their (180 euro) service to meet us at the airport and speed us to the hotel by road and water taxis worked very well. On arrival the rather curt clerk boasted about the restaurant's Michelin starred restaurant, so I asked if we could book a table for that evening - he said they were fully booked, so I asked him to book us for the next evening; he rather grudgingly took my details and said he would "let me know". I never heard a word, but I can tell you that the restaurant was never full on any night we were there and it would be easy to believe that he was, perhaps, looking for some encouragement to find us a table. The bar is tiny and if you fail to get one of the few tables you can really struggle to get a drink - maybe i'm impatient but sitting on a bar stool for 15 minutes without being served, in a 4 star hotel, is no fun. Staff away from the desk were charming and efficient - our room was small but beautiful and cleanliness is first rate. Breakfast is weird and the Orange Juice was unforgivably poor, and extra! After our (no) booking experience we shunned the restaurant - it's a bit "Heston Blumental" for our tastes anyway. We often ate just along the Riva Schiavoni at the Llondra Palace's "Do Leoni" restaurant, which is expensive but first class. On our last night it was raining cats and dogs and we had to walk to the Llondra for dinner, so I asked one of the desk staff for an umbrella. You would think I'd asked him for his wages - his reaction was one of incredulity that I should ask! Could we have done better? Certainly. For a little more money the Llondra Palace looks a much better bet.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: 1965cooper
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Metropole most years since 1988 - our first visit was our honeymoon. Unlike some of the reviewers, we love the decor - classically Venetian, with bold colours and beautiful fabrics. For us, the antique furniture adds to the atmosphere - perhaps not as comfortable as furniture found in more modern hotels but very appropriate to the overall environment. The front desk staff are not over friendly but we find them efficient, the staff within the restauruant are lovely and always find the time to talk to us and unlike many hotels we have stayed in around the world, our children. We have stayed as a couple, as a large party with friends, with our parents and for the last 13 years with our children. Rooms vary enormously, most are medium to small, the suites are fantastic and the family rooms are medium sized and comfortable. The location is perfect but you must expect some noise in such a central location - Venice is a busy place and many of the day tourists enter the city close to the hotel. We have never had any complaints and the restaurant is a must - don't do it though if you are on a tight budget!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service at the Metropole”
Reviews.Author: itsasmallworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropole for three nights last month, during the Biennale. We had 2 double rooms and one triple. The triple room was very spacious and overlooked the basin of the Grand Canal. We felt so fortunate to have a view of the Canal and San Giorgio Maggiore from the three large windows (which opened fully) in our room. Between our two double rooms, one was spacious, the other was very small. The hotel is very well-located â€“ near Piazza San Marco and directly in front of the water bus station. Some of the outstanding features of the hotel include the private water taxi landing, lovely indoor (but even more lovely outdoor) breakfast room, excellent breakfast offering, several wood benches in the front of the hotel to relax and take in the view, cordial and very helpful front desk staff, indoor, air conditioned lounge area where you can enjoy afternoon tea or just sit down and listen to the live piano music after a long day of walking, great little toiletries in the bathroom and coffee service in the lobby in the early morning. The only reservation I have with the hotel is the aura throughout. Incense is placed and spices are sprinkled in trays, bowls and vases throughout the lobby, lounge and hallways, so that a somewhat exotic (at times heavy) scent permeates the air. It can sometimes be a little overwhelming. Also, the dark colored accents and the eclectic collection of art and artifacts throughout the hotel, and in some of the rooms, is sometimes halting. I would still highly recommend this hotel as it provides subtly elegant, comfortable and convenient surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiResident
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel at their private water entrance by water taxi is a wonderful way to arrive in Venice. The entire experience is great. Breakfast is average though but I certainly would not call it bad. Great artefact collection displayed in the common area, lovely lounge, a Michelin starred restaurant and classic rooms that complete the Venetian experience. The location is perfect! Close to San Marco and yet away from the crowds. Avoid the hotel's 'free' trip to Murano though. You are always better off on your own. No such thing as a free lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodations Only OK, Location Great”
Reviews.Author: jvos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Metropole for 2 nights in February. The hotel itself is very quaint looking; it has that "European" feel and there are also some interesting "collections" of corks, fans, evening purses, and crucifixes scattered about. We have been to Europe 4 times now over the past 3 years or so and we expect the hotel rooms to be very small. However, the room at the Metropole was very, very, very small and oddly decorated. The color scheme was monochromatic, which is fine, but the color of choice was olive green, making everything seem dark. The room was clean, though. Although there was a new flat-screen TV on the wall, we didn't make much use of it since there was only one English channel. Be prepared for a very firm, uncomfortable bed. The bathroom was also small but well-appointed. The bath salts were particularly nice at the end of a long day of walking. We only went to the bar (Zodiac) at the hotel once and it is very interesting-looking, so it was worth an expensive drink just to see it. We did not find the desk staff to be overly helpful or friendly (except for the people in the restaurant, who were very pleasant each morning) and we were glad to not have to rely on them to find our way around Venice or make dinner reservations. The one really great thing about the Metropole is the location. It is a very short walk to the Palazzo Ducale (Doge's Palace) and St. Mark's Square. Speaking of Doge's Palace, the best thing we did in Venice was to take the Secret Itineraries Tour there. It was extremely interesting and we saw the "jail cell" where Casanova was held and from which he ultimately escaped to Paris. This tour costs an additional fee but was totally worth it; just be aware you need to reserve your spot at least the day before. (You may need to reserve earlier but when we were there in February, it was very quiet and slow all around, which is the best way to see Europe!)

Reviews.Title: “perfect for carnevale”
Reviews.Author: parlamio
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to any reviews that complain about the concierge or "thin walls". This is an excellent hotel with 5star service. It is perfect proximity from Piazza San Marco, especially during Carnevale as it is close enough to walk to, but far enough to get some space from the crowds. My room was big and beautiful with a roof top terrace, kingsized 4 poster bed, bathrobes, heated towels -- everything. I booked early through Metropole's website, and emailed them in Italian that I wanted a room on a higher floor with a terrace, and not too small. I got exactly what I asked for. And there are not alot of terrace rooms available. Each day housekeeping brought me fruit I preferred, I never had to tell the staff my name more than once, and yes there are some concierge that are not as accomodating as others -- but it's easy to pick out which ones are. Room service was exceptional as they would make things that were not on the menu and at times of the day when hot items for example were not available, would make them for you anyway. And I got a very good rate for a single, considering the size of the room, because I booked early directly through the hotel. Don't bother with Travelocity or Expedia or even a tour operator. Venice is very easy to travel to and visit alone without a third party's assistance. And location is very close to San Zaccaria Alliguna stop from Airport -- concierge will help you to the boat with your luggage when you leave if you ask early, nicely, and tip well. But treat yourself if you can to arrive at hotel via water taxi as they have their own stop and it's so much faster after a long night flight from US.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better than the Metropole”
Reviews.Author: hoteluserNottingham
Reviews.Content: The metropole is a nice hotel, it just wasn't what I expected. The staff were not friendly on check in - in fact we were considered an extreme inconvenience turning up to be allocated the 3 rooms we'd booked. The decor is good, but there are joss sticks burning constantly in the reception and lounge area, so if you don't like this smell........... you're a bit stuck! Breakfast was very basic, not what you'd expect from a 4 star. Bar menu extremely limited if you didn't want to spend 65 Euros a head in the restaurant. As we had 3 rooms booked, we saw quite a variance in size and decor!! 1 room really good, the other 2, mediocre to be honest. Having previously stayed at the Bellini which was FIRST CLASS, we picked the Metropole to be nearer St Marks - believe me, with this hotel it is all about location - there are much nicer hotels in Venice, and unlike the previous reviewer, I can honestly see why there are 43 hotels above this one! A nice stay, but not at all special.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding seven day stay at the Metropole”
Reviews.Author: alicante
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a seven day lovely stay at the Metropole. As we are hotel owners ourselves in the California wine country we are naturally overly picky about other properties we visit. Alas, we could not find a single fault with this hotel. The accomodations were spacious, clean and extremely comfortable . The decor of the hotel was beautiful; a combination of Venetian antiques (not overly done) combined with modern amenities. The staff was attentive, helpful and very friendly. The breakfasts were consistently fresh and the service outstanding. The food and service at the Met restaurant was, as expected, first class. We would not hesitate to recommend the Metropole again as the experience we had could not have been better. I have a hard time bbelieving that there are 43 more popular hotels in Venice but that is OK. This way I know we will have a better chance of booking on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Woul love to go back”
Reviews.Author: tim22
Reviews.Content: Before taking a cruise around the Greek Islands we had an overnight stay in the Metropole. The hotel has a wonderful location just a few hundred yards from San Marco square. First impressions are excellent as you can pull up in your water taxi right at the hotels door. The staff were very attentive and went out of their way to be helpful. The dÃ©cor was rich and luxurious with wonderful warm colours. We were a little wary after reading previous reviews but our family room turned out to be excellent, plenty of room with wonderful views. Unfortunately we couldnâ€™t get a table in the restaurant that night but as we were returning in seven days time we booked for our next visit. On our return we were treated to an excellent meal in the Michelin starred restaurant. The quality of food was first rate, as was the presentation. The setting for the restaurant exuded a real feeling of luxurious quality which was matched by the wonderful service we received. The chef is clearly very talented and runs an excellent kitchen. The Metropole is not cheap (Not much is in Venice) but it does represent good value for money. Fantastic location and so very pleasing in every respect, I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: macR80
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for 3 nights in August.The hotel was lovely and very near san marcos square. I asked for aroom with a side canal view and got it. I was delighted as we had a balocny overlooking the canal for no extra cost.Also there are only two rooms in the hotel with a balcony which made it even better.I think our room number was 246. We didnt eat in the hotel as it was quite expensive and very quiet.The staff were friendly and very helpful.The hotel has its own water taxi stop. We didnt use it as there is a public water bus stop directly opposite the hotel. The only negative thing iis the walls are very thin and on our last night we could hear the people next door making alot of noise.!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Metropole met expectations”
Reviews.Author: gmgilchrist
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is excellent; just a short stroll to San Marco. The Metropole has its own water taxi stop. This is very good for people who prefer not to pull heavy suitcases through narrow, crowded streets. I think the bigger boat from the airport stops just 2 bridges along from the hotel. The room was of modest size and nicely decorated with that lovely deep red colour. There were interesting displays of antique collectables in the lobby. The restaurant looked pretty nice but we always ate lunch and dinner in town. Breakfast was fine in a pleasant room.. The price was slightly cheaper than Monaco and Grand Canal and below that of Londra Palace. There's nothing to choose between them on location. The staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJU
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice and stayed at the Metropole for 4 days and three nights (10/8 - 10/12). One of the reasons for selecting this hotel were the comments here in trip advisor. I would certainly recommend staying here. We paid 330 euro a night ( a tad on the expensive side) but the room (see photos)and service were all excellent. Breakfast was included and there was a good variety for the breakfast buffet. Room included a balcony deck. Staff personnel always willing and helpful. Very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel, let down by poor service”
Reviews.Author: Wooshi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Metropole in Venice 3rd September to 9th September. The hotel is full of antiques and character. Our room was wonderful - a lagoon view at the front of the hotel on the 2nd floor. Whilst a small twin room, this is an old hotel and the room was clean with fresh towels twice a day and an immaculate bathroom. The room was decorated with antique fans, walls lined with fabric and wonderful drapes. There is a haridryer fixed in the bathroom, but if you want a powerul one, take your own. The service was sadly of poor standard - the tone being set by the General Manager (a different person to the gentlement the honeymoon couple refer to as excellent). He was rude, poor English and generally not interested in our custom. Breakfast is a standard Italian buffet - fresh fruit salad, fresh breads, hot coffee, ham, cheese etc. It is disappointing you have to pay an addition Euros 6 for a juice though! Location - perfect. It has its own water landing which is ideal if you get a water taxi arrival (would defintely recommend) and near Vaperetto stops to enable you to easily and cheaply get around Venice. We spent an hour in the hotel Zodiac bar - 5 Prosecco's was Euros 60. This service again was not ideal - a dish of nuts and glasses refilled rather than fresh glasses each time we had another! In comparison the Bellinis at the Londra Palace (hotel a few minutes walk down, nearer St Marks) were wonderful - made with fresh peaches (therefore not available if they are not in season) with a dish of nibbles (nuts, skewers of olives etc) and pleasant service! I would go back to this hotel despite the service - location is perfect and price is good for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: NatashaGrace
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location. We were disappointed in the both the cleanliness and need of updating in the room. If you need a water taxi, walk down to the canal and negotiate your own rate. We were charged 100 Euro for very brief ride to the cruise ship terminal. The hotel staff arranged this for us stating "On Sunday, they only let certain water taxis into the harbor". The cruise ship staff was shocked when they learned how much we were charged. We had no idea how close it was and should have walked down and arranged our own rate or taken the public water taxis. We felt the hotel staff lacked integrity taking advantage of tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Old and dated room”
Reviews.Author: VegasDan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July 2006. Positives: Location is great--very close to San Marco square and close to the Vaperetto and Aliguna water bus stations for convenient access to everywhere else in Venice. Breakfast buffet was good. Negatives: Room was very old and dated, and not clean. There was a black moldy looking substance that extended around the room between the walls and ceiling. The air conditioning vent also had this black moldy substance. Bathroom was small and dated--old tile floors. Overall, the hotel looked very old and tired. Air conditioning did not work very well, with the room feeling humid and warm. Add to that the damp smell of the room which made for not a very enjoyable stay at the hotel. Venice, on the other hand, was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My now wife and I got married in Venice and stayed at the beautiful hotel Metropole who also arranged a reception for 26 in their beautiful courtyard. I cannot praise this hotel highly enough. The beautiful detail is everywhere you look and is both ornate and stunning. Mr Bon the hotel manager looked after us personally and the restaurant and bar manager Lucio deserves a special mention for giving us his time and for the simply amazing 5 course reception lunch that was served in the courtyard which had been decorated with white flowers and drapes. Our room was wonderful and the service we received throughout our stay was of the highest standard. We travelled on to other hotels in Italy during our honeymoon none of which compared to Hotel Metropole despite being of similar price and star rating. We intend to go back for anniversaries and would have no hesitation in recomending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: WC1
Reviews.Content: Very good location right on the canal only a short walk to St Marks square. Rooms were on the small side but beautiifully clean. The hotel is unusually decorated with many antiques and other curios. Restuarant was very expensive but there are plenty of other places to eat well and for a reasonable price as long as you stay away from St Marks. You can do Venice cheap or pricey it really is up to you. There was a free trip to the glass blowing at Murano and this was just an opportunity for them to sell you exceptionally over prices glassware but it was fun pretending to the sales staff that you have the money to buy and although they guide you round the shop they are not pushy but go to the gift shop at the end for some bargain souvenirs. On the whole lovely stay and would go back. Ps don't have afternoon tea at the hotel as it costs Â£12 just for the cake!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Metropole in May 2006. Our room was small, but very clean and modern with a small balcony. What a view! After reading negative comments online about the front desk staff we were surprised to find them both helpful and friendly. Our luggage got lost and they helped with calls to the airline (they offered to do this, we didnt ask). They gave us friendly greetings each morning and evening. The bar was a nice place to relax with affordable drinks. The bartenders were polite and professional, but kinda of quiet. The hotel's location is perfect, just a short walk from St. Mark's square. About a 15 minute walk to the Riatlo Bridge with plenty to see along the way. We got caught up in sightseeing and getting out and about each day and did not get to eat at the hotel. Breakfast Buffet and restaraunt both looked wonderful. Will make it a point to eat there next time. Cannot wait to return to Venice and the Metropole, would not consider staying any where else. Dont believe the negative comments you may read, this is a first class hotel with a wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “The gratest Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Andreas_D_68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Metropole Hotel for 4 days (19-22/5/06), and those were the most enjoyable 4 days I spent in any hotel I have ever visited. It is indeed a great Hotel in any aspect. Metropole has great rooms, both in size & luxury (for Venice thatâ€™s a rare combination). The provided services are of top level. The personnel always willing to help you and satisfy all of your needs. Last but not least the restaurant â€œMETâ€� one of the greatest restaurants I have ever been. If anyone needs to get out of conventional Hotels, Metropole Hotel is definitely the place to stay when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Much to Praise!”
Reviews.Author: ReviewerCB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropole in May of this year- after a lot of research- to celebrate my husband's birthday. Firstly, yes, Venice is as wonderful as everyone says it is, despite the crowds and the expense. Just to stand on the Rialto bridge and view the Grand Canal took my breath away. So if you get a chance to visit - take it. The Metropole is well located and quite ordinary looking from the outside. However inside it is a lot more pleasing. We found the communal areas of the hotel to be fantastic - very atmospheric and interesting. Outside is a beautiful garden in which you can chill out and relax -read a book or order coffee or cocktails. The bar staff were extremely friendly and professional - I found the reception staff a little more aloof but pleasant and very efficient non the less. At no time during our three night stay were we invited to visit the glass factories of Murano - it was never ever mentioned. Our bedroom was a junior suite and I've got to say I wasn't that keen on the decor - it was immaculately clean and towels etc. were changed twice a day - but for me it needed a spot of upgrading even taking into account its historical/antique leanings . I do accept however that this comes down to personal taste. It certainly didn't spoil my stay. Breakfasts were fabulous if , like me, you're not too bothered about anything hot. This was available, yes, but at an additional cost. The selection of fresh fruits, cereals, breads, meats and cheeses was more than adequate at that time of the morning and the breakfast staff very accommodating. St. Mark's is a five to ten minute walk away and the water buses a couple of hundred metres. Would I visit again - yes - but maybe not in a junior suite this time. The hotel as a whole however was quite impressive and certainly worthy of serious consideration.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: donnamaria329
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropole from April 17-21. When we arrived they upgraded our room to a Canal view. I thought the hotel was very dark and somewhat morbid. Many antiques and uncomforable old furniture. After one night in our Canal view room we asked to be moved to a quieter location. Being on the 1st floor, with no air conditioning and unable to open the windows since anyone could have looked into our room,we were very disappointed in this hotel. The noise level was almost deafening due to the hordes of people walking by our room or the toot from the vaporettos which was leaving every 15 minutes up until midnight. They changed our room the the 2nd floor overlooking the small canal. We still had a view of the Grand Canal, but now every 10 minutes a speed boat passed by all night. The bar and staff where excellent and very accommodating. We didn't eat in the restaurant, the menu was very expensive and not to our taste. The garden in the back of the hotel was very quiet and nice to sit in and have a drink. The hotel is centrally located in Venice. Should we every get back to Venice, we won't be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Metropole”
Reviews.Author: Nik
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend mid-March and were very pleased with our choice of hotel. It does not look too special from the outside but you will not be disappointed once you have stepped inside. The hotel is very welcoming and has a lovely atmosphere (and a very pleasant smell). The lounge area at the front of the hotel is the perfect place to unwind after a day's sightseeing. Helpful staff. Our room was on the first floor overlooking the canal. Despite this, it was extremely quiet and was very spacious and comfortable. The marble bathroom had soft, white, fluffy towels and a heated floor - bliss. We had breakfast at the hotel which offered a wide variety of cereals, fruits, breads, pastries, hams, cheeses etc, but, with the extensive choice of restaurants in Venice, we chose to eat out in the evenings. There is a garden area to the rear which I'm sure is a very pleasant place to be on a summer evening. The hotel has a great location, fronting the lagoon and steps from St Mark's Square, the Campanile and Doge's Palace. Ferries to the other islands as well as the Vaporetto are within yards of the front door. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Would also recommend a water taxi for transport to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “could be rated five stars but...”
Reviews.Author: lmpb
Reviews.Content: We stated at the Metropole hotel in Venice for 9 days, from the 7th to the 16th of april.We were 2 parents, 3 kids and a baby. The location of the hotel is a little far from the center of Venice, but as you walk kms in Venice, it's not a big deal. The hotel is very charming with all these antiques, even if beeing Europeans we are less impressed by old things we can find in our own family houses than Americans. Nevertheless it's very nice and charming. We had a brand newly renovated room with gorgious mosaÃ¯c bathroom and a superb laguna and San Giorgio view. We wished we could have had big windows instead of the typically venetian tiny windows ! The kids had a double room overlooking the back of the hotel ("garden view"), with a permanent noise of fridge engine in the garden, but that did not bother them.They just closed the window. At the beginning in our room the heating was off, but they finally put it on. The beds were very confortable. The breakfast was excellent : fruit salads, cheese, delicious pastries, hams and despite the morning crowd, the staff always managed to find a place for everyone. The service was very efficient. They found a perfect baby sitter for our baby.And that was really a must ! We did not try the restaurant (1 star at the Michelin), just the room service which was quick and good. The little garden behind the hotel is very pleasant, and rare in Venice, and it's nice to have a little rest there after breakfast and before laving the hotel for hours of walk. So why don't we give 5 stars ? Just because they had no internet connection in the hotel and that we had to go to a internet cafe every evening to get our mails, and that was no fun after a day of walking. And also because the area to take the tea was not very cosy as it was shared by the restaurant. By the way, the roomservice depending on the restaurant, there's no hot room service on Monday as the restaurant is closed. But they could serve you cold dishes. Conclusion : very good stay, the kids were delighted, except the little imperfections you should have a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Tired of chains? Elegant, classic and personnel hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: LadyQ
Reviews.Content: We spent Easter in this hotel, which was a memorable expirence. The rooms are to die for with real antics from 19th centuary or older. The standard rooms are mediumsized to small, but since the ceiling is so high it seems bigger. The best views are to the lagoon, but the canal views are also nice. Good bathroom. The location is near San Marco and don't forget to prebook the Dodge palace's secret itinaries tour, which is a tour in tourture chambers, investigation rooms and Casanova's cells. If you are going by boat to other islands, the ferry terminals are just outside. The location could not be any better, considering that there are no cars in Venice, why a hotel that is not very near the water means carring bags in crowded streets. Breakfast is the best I have ever got in Italy and served on dippers changing tables from late 19th centurary. The hotel make their own jam, youghurt and bread. Great variety of fruits, hams and cheeseas well. For Easter Sunday every one got a big chocolate egg, very nice gesture. The bar as well as the restaurant has a cosy athmosphere, which draw you to it, but as many other reviwers have pointed out the service can be rather bad. When we sat down with drinks before being shown to the table I noticed a french couple standing up to get the servants attention to be placed at the table after the drinks, totally ignored. 50 minutes after receiving our drinks we were in the same position. This restaurant has a michelin star and according to the new rules of the guide, only the food is judged for receiving one star. The hotel should do something about the organisation both regarding the moving people from aperitif table to the dinner settings and serving the wine before the food. Several times it was the other way around. Saying that I still prefer bad service to bad food, and the food is well worth the star. If you eat at the restuarant try the gourmet menu and you understand why it is a michelin star restuarant. The lamb was delious and the chocolate plate couldn't be described in words. The clientel are mostly italian, french and amaricans, often with children. Great place for couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmosydney
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six days with my mother in early December, a beautiful time to be in Venice, when the crowds are gone and if you are lucky (like we were) you can enjoy the beauty of the city under crisp azure skies. Having spent four weeks in Venice about five years ago, the Metropole was everything I would expect from a Venetian hotel. The location is terrific and could not be more convenient. We had a superb room at the back overlooking the garden - very spacious, with a sitting room and large bathroom with a huge tub. The decor of the hotel is charming, not over the top cliche Venetian, but just the right ambience. It has the feel of a well established club to which people return over and over again. My favourite room in the hotel was the front sitting room where you can sit after coming back from dinner and enjoy the wonderful pianist and have a nightcap. The desk staff varied from extremely helpful to very off-hand. We ate at the hotel on one night and were not impressed with the food. Breakfast was excellent, a full range of pretty much anything you can imagine and helpful staff. I would love to return in the summer and enjoy the garden, and the small bar is also a lot of fun. The Metropole has a water taxi stand and although it is expensive I recommend that everybody take the opportunity just once in their life to arrive at their hotel in this way. Venice unfolds before you, and then you alight - pure magic!!

Reviews.Title: “Unique, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madpepe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real find, right on the Riva degli Schiavoni, romantic, affordable and comfortable. The decor is unique and and public spaces are crammed with various collections by the hotel's owner. Service is attentive. My room ( a mini-suite) was memorable, spacious with canal and coutyard views and magnificent period furniture. No cookie-cutter rooms here. The bathroom was modern and well appointed. A full delicious breakfast of local fare was served in a lovely dining hall, and the atmospheric bar was a cozy place to unwind in the evenings. Front desk was helpful and professional. I dined in the restaurant which was an overall very good experience, although the service started out slow. Cuisine was inventive and delicious, however, one of the best meals I had in Venice. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous hotel, definitely stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend stay at the Metropole. The rooms were absolutely gorgeous, luxurious bed linens, large flat screen tv on the wall, wonderful bathroom with a great european soaking tub. It was hard to believe we were able to have such luxury with the great off-season rate we got. We stayed on the 4th floor (there was an elevator) and our room had a lovely terrace, where we could sit outside and see the canal. The breakfast was the best we had in Italy, and the location couldn't be beat, just steps from St. Mark's Square and almost next to the Ducale Palace. When asked, the concierges were helpful with making restaurant reservations and suggestions. We would definitely love to stay at the Metropole again.

Reviews.Title: “il meglio che ci sia - As goog as they come!”
Reviews.Author: ceunant
Reviews.Content: The Metropole Hotel is ideally located for the main attractions of Venice, while it may look like nothing special on the outside, but inside you enter a really magical place! Filled with antique furniture, unusual and facinating collections of antiques. Very romantic and intimate atmosphre at night with flickering candles and soft music. We stayed stayed in room 251 "The Angel Suite" which was unique but wonderfully camp!! The room was massive with a huge bed on a raised platform surrounded by marble pillars, We shared the room with 16 cherubs, two angels and stars on the ceiling above the bed (104 - to save anyone else from counting!!) The large luxurious marble bathroom had underfloor heating and was lovely. The staff all spoke good English and the service was excellent - nothing was too much trouble. The Met restaurant at the Hotel is apparently superb but perhaps they need a better translator for the menu.....? We failed to be tempted by the English menu which featured "special goose liver ice cream floating in coffee with sand and chocolate" & "Shaken raw peas with chocolate and yellow flour cannolo, liquorice foam"!! The Metropole is a perfect hotel for couples and we would highly recommend it to anyone hoping for a romantic break in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: MamaRugg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this year at the carnivale. Staff were very friendly, service was good, breakfast was average! Our room was overlooking a courtyard which was fine and the underfloor heating in the bathroom was sheer bliss! (No bath though!bit disappointed!) We were at the end of a corridor and it was very quiet. The atmosphere in the bar was lovely with lighted candles all day and incense burning. Would definately go back even though they messed up our bill - overcharging us by 300 euros!!

Reviews.Title: “Apalling service”
Reviews.Author: Smurflady
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were in Venice over New Year and had read good things about the cocktails made in the bar of the Metropole. We decided to visit for after dinner cocktails on the evening of January 1 2006. After a pleasant greeting from the doorman on entry to the hotel, the service went rapidly downhill from there. We walked over to the cramped bar and were told we would be better off taking a seat in the lounge area, even though there were a couple of seats still left unoccupied in the bar area. We made our way to the lounge and were then ignored by ALL the waiters for a good 20 mins. Eventually, someone came over to take our order. As mentioned earlier, the cocktails were supposed to be very good here so I ordered a starwberry daiquiri and my partner ordered a caiprinha. A further wait of 20 to 25 mins ensued and then a different waiter returned to us, telling us that the bar had no strawberries for the daiquiri and the barman was unable to make a caiprinha as it would take hime too long to find out how it was supposed to be made. No apology was given. We decided to leave and will not recommend anyone bother to go there for their "famous cocktails".

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay at the Metropole”
Reviews.Author: ABonnie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I very much enjoyed our stay at the Metropole. It's a quirky little place, with odd "collections" of things, such as crucifixes in cases, a touch a found a bit disconcerting. We found the room to be rather small (typical for Europe) and not as nicely decorated or comfortable (mainly meaning the bed) as should have been for the price. We'd paid extra for the "canal view" that I'd read was a necessity. Since we were located on the second floor directly above the main drag (forgot the name) and often looked out the window to find tourists snapping pictures of our hotel, we didn't feel comfortable keeping the window open. I would save your money and stay in a non-view room! The common areas were very comfortable. We enjoyed sitting in the bar at night for a few drinks and desserts. The breakfast was delicious! We were very impressed with the waitstaff, who seemed to speak at least 3-4 languages each. Not something you'd find in the US, for sure. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Metropole, but next time, I think I would look for a hotel hidden away in those fabulous winding alleyways of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Christmas Treat”
Reviews.Author: Porpex
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent our Christmas at the Metropole Hotel in Venice, and it proved to be a very festive choice. Nestled on the lagoon and accessible by boat, the hotel is a true charmer. Outside, it was festooned with brightly colored lights to mark the holiday. Inside, the lobby was a riot of heavy red velvet brocades, twinkling lights, overstuffed antiques, rampant greenery, and large, glass cases filled with local curios, ranging from gilded cigarette boxes to a giant collection of corkscrews. With remarkable ease, the hotel manages to seamlessly blend incredible whimsy with five-star panache. Our room was resplendent pink, with four large, marble columns surrounding the massive bed. Service was attentive without being obtrusive, and the concierge was especially helpful in recommending local eateries, and providing directions that allowed us to navigate the maze-like streets of this intoxicating town. We had Christmas Eve dinner in the hotel's Michelin starred restaurant; while we enjoyed it, we found ourselves a bit too jet-lagged to appreciate the unending parade of exotic dishes...our eyes were bigger than our stomachs, and some of the fare--most notably, cuttlefish with polenta in a chestnut sauce--won points for innovation but not for taste. That was our only caveat about this romantic hideaway...a magical place to stay in a city that never fails to amaze, delight and intrigue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Casmir
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Great location. Well worth the cost. If you can afford the money, get one of the special rooms, i.e. 401. Staff was very helpful with directions and restaurant reservations.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem: Best Value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: PhillyTravelers4
Reviews.Content: Venice is a really, really expensive proposition...especially with a family. Traveling with two teenagers, we were looking for two connecting rooms. As I researched accomodations, I was shocked at the prices until I contacted the Metropole. To my surprise, two connecting rooms that formed a suite were the same price as one room at the Gritti Palace, or the Luna Baglione. It sounded so good that I was almost afraid to book it. But after reading reviews and speaking to several people who had been there....and had also been pleasantly surprised by the value...we made our reservations. From the moment we arrived, it was delightful. The water taxi pulled right up the the door of the hotel...a big bonus. No worries about schlepping luggage across the piazza. The staff was gracious and helpful. Our corner suite of rooms was spacious, charming and spotless--master bathroom outstanding. Breakfast in the morning was an adventure and the hotel's location was superb. I hope these people keep doing what they are doing making it possible for families to travel comfortably and almost affordably! I will say that my sister did not enjoy her stay as much as we did...Clearly it depends on the rooms you are assigned. As it is more of a traditional Venetian lodging...not a Holiday Inn, the rooms are not uniform in their size or appointments. Out of curiosity, we did visit the Gritti Palace. It looked like it had definitely seen better days...sort of old and worn out. We were glad that we had chosen the Metropole and would do so again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem !”
Reviews.Author: joscco
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights here last January on a city break with my wife. Hotel was in a great location,three minutes walk from San Marco and next door to the Vivaldi church with great views over the lagoon. Great food and friendly staff also helped make our stay special. The thing we liked most was this hotels originality,the glass cases filled with curios and the opulent slightly OTT decor all added to the feeling that it was a really unique place. We are frequent travellers,and i travel abroad regularly with my work but this hotel sticks out as being pretty special. I would definately recommend it and hope it never changes.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deeburkett
Reviews.Content: If you want a lovely cosy warm friendly hotel - then the Metropole is the one for you. My husband and myself and a couple of our close friends have just returned from a 3 night break at this wonderful hotel. From the minute we stepped off the water taxi to the minute we left the staff could not do enough for us and made us feel so welcome. From the guys on the front desk, to the lovely head barman, to the cleaning staff, to the waitresses in the restaurant - thank you - they were fantastic - so so friendly. The hotel is very opulent and we had a room on the second floor facing the lagoon, which was very very comfortable - although the pillows are a little on the firm side! It was beautifully decorated and very warm and cosy. The bathroom was excellent and the shower hot and powerful. Breakfast was great, with cold meats, cheeses, breads, pastries, porridge, fresh druits etc - it was just what you needed to set yourself up until lunch time. We ate in the restaurant which has been awarded a Michellin Star and it was stunning - the service was excellent and it was a gastronomic delight. It was a little expensive 300 Euros for the 4 of us, but it did include wine, and was a very leisurely and pleasant evening. The hotel is situated very close to Saint Marcs square and also very close to the water bus stops which take you all around the City. We arrived by private water taxi which was lovely, but decided to be adventurous and got the Aquilaguna back to the airport at a cost of 10 Euros each - it ran from a couple of hundred yards from the hotel and was every hour - the front desk at the hotel have the timetable and told us about it - it takes a little over an hour and was a great way to travel! If you want luxury but with a lovely cosy feel with good old fashioned values but not stuffy like some - then the Metropole is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: libanks
Reviews.Content: After searching for hotels in Venice we decided to stay at the Metropole. The hotel was very beautiful and in a great location, a 5 minute walk to San Marco. My husband and I opted for the water bus rather then the water taxi. The bus was only 10 euro compared to 80 euro for the taxi. However, if you have several bags, I do not recommend this because it is a 10 minutes walk from the bus stop. Our room was small, which is typical in Europe, but decorated beautifully and the bathroom was spotless. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet and was surprised by the selections of meats, cheeses, bread and fruit. Very different from your complimentary breakfast at U.S. hotels. We also had lunch in the garden, which was very nice and also very expensive. The location is great. You are close to restaurants, shops and all the major tourists sites. However, there are hundreds and hundreds of tourists. We were amazed! We definitely recommend the Metropole!

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico Metropole!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Metropole is bellissima! I cannot recommend the hotel highly enough. My girlfriend and I spent some nights at this magnicent jewell of a hotel while we were attending the Venice Film Festival during the first week of September. We opted for this hotel, rather than the Excelsior on the Lido (site of the festival) and the excellent Cipriani on Giudeca. All staff members were friendly and helpful; the chef is amazing; he prepared an exquisite platter of savory Venetian seafood delicacies. Dining in the garden for breakfast is an enchanting way to begin the day on "La Serenissima" ---- our room was quite ample, with a view of the canal --- we arrived during a tempest; but we left with sunshine in our hearts and souls -- and I can see why Vivaldi was inspired to compose "The Four Seasons" on these sacred grounds! Grazie tanto, per tutti --- Hotel Metropole --- we vow to return to "Paradiso" - the Metropole - as soon as we can!

Reviews.Title: “Room With A View”
Reviews.Author: Whirlwind_Girl
Reviews.Content: I arrived by private water taxi at 9 in the morning. The "double room with side canal or garden view" which I had reserved at the hotel's Web site was not yet ready. The concierge suggested a single room with a view of the lagoon for 130 Euros per night. Initially, I was disappointed because this room was quite small, but when the bellhop opened the windows, there was amazing sunlight, fresh air, and a panoramic water view. There was a pink crystal chandelier on the ceiling and decorative fans on the walls. The room was perfect for me as I was traveling alone. I asked the bellhop to show me my original room (for comparison) and it too was small. It overlooked the side canal and was dark. The common areas of this hotel are exotic, sumptuous, and breathtaking beyond words. There is a restaurant and I would have liked to have eaten dinner there, but the prices on the menu seemed outrageous to me. The hotel is a short walk to St. Marcos Square. The location is excellent, especially for first time visitors to Venice, but be prepared for hordes of other tourists in the hotel's immediate environs. I visited in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Metropole in a word: LOVELY”
Reviews.Author: CarolJL1
Reviews.Content: Inspired by other reviewers at TripAdvisor & Venere[-] we booked 2 nights at the Metropole as we began a 2 week stay in Italy. As with the vast majority of viewers we found the service, location, comfort and character of the Metropole to be one of the best, if not the best, in Venice proper. Will most definitely recommend to friends and return ourselves. Dined at the Hotel's restaurant our first night and had a lovely experience. The menu is a novelle cuisine twist on traditional Venetian dishes. While not for the weak of heart or bland of palate (sturgeon tartare, lobster ravioli with wasabi sauce, etc.) the 3-course meal was impeccably prepared and presented. The highlight of the meal was the fresh sorbetto with several tasty, not overly sweet sorbetti in unusual flavors (melon, kiwi, currant, mango) presented on a delicious buttery pastry "pallete. " Dinner was a bit pricey (about $300 for a 2.5 hour, 3-course meal, mid-priced wine, dessert & gratuity) but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Romantic Charm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all I must say a big thank you to all of the previous review writers your words inspired me to book this hotel and have one of the most fantastic trips I have had. As for the Hotel - WOW - beautiful room (325), with a fantastic view over the lagoon. I took my partner as a surprise and on the first night we arrived she refused to leave the tranquil beauty of the hotel surroundings. So we moved down stairs for an evening meal in the gardens. Again fantastic with service to match, there is no attention to detail the people around you miss. One of the most original meals I have ever had the pleasure of tasting. Sensational from start to finish. They even went out of there way for my partner - most people don't know where to start with a Vegan - but they did very well indeed. I was so taken with the romantic surroundings I also chose that as my moment to propose. Breakfast the following day was as fantastic - serving up a veritable banquette of Cakes, hams, cheeses, and fruit. More than enough to fill yourself on for a pounding the streets of Venice. Overall a fantastic trip made extra special by the staff and the ambience at the Metropole. I can't thank them enough - I hope you feel the same if and when you go. By the way - She said yes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ambience”
Reviews.Author: VM2
Reviews.Content: My Husband,17yr daughter and myself loved staying here.The ambience set by the hotel made you feel as if you had stepped back in time.The Hotel was full of antiques and antique collections and the outdoor garden area where breakfast and dinner were served was quite beautiful.The small lounge bar was almost moroccan in decor and a favourite place of ours before going to dinner.The staff at reception were very helpful and friendly.This hotel also has a fantastic position.We caught a water taxi right to the hotel door and it was only a short walk to St Marks Square.Our bedroom and bathroom were very spacious,the bathroom was very well appointed and looked brand new.We would definitely return to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: therap4paws
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropole in July 2005 after searching through many hotels in venice on the internet. Using tripadvisor, we chose metropole b\c the reviews were good and it was somewhat affordable. We were very pleased with the location and appearence of the hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and accomodating. It was a total contrast from other places in Italy we had visited. The room was a bit small and the "double" bed was really just 2 twin beds, separately made up with a large queen size comforter over the 2 of them but they were comfortable anyway. The room was clean and well styled with a flat screen TV. They advertised heated towel racks in the bathroom but we didn't have them in our room. The bathroom and shower were small but clean and manageable. Overall, the hotel was a bit pricey for an extended stay but for one nite, it suited us fine.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Treat”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After much planning and consideration, I chose the Metropole for a week's holiday to compensate my wife for officially reaching middle-age.
