It would have been a waste not to take advantage of the hotel's private water taxi entrance, so we arrived in style from the airport. Every aspect of this hotel was excellent: I had arranged champagne in the room for our arrival directly with the hotel in advance, nothing was too much trouble for the staff on the front desk, rooms were immaculate and individually furnished with antiques, and the breakfasts catered for all tastes. Added to this was the fact that the hotel was conveniently situated whilst being a little away from the biggest crowds. Throughout our visit it was noticeable how all staff, irrespective of their duties, acknowledged guests. Despite comments I have read from a number of people, I found neither Venice nor the Metropole itself to be any more expensive than other major cities (with the possible exception of Harry's Bar - pricey but first class food/service)...but Venice is unique and would have been worth a premium anyway!

Reviews.Title: “First rate!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, minutes from the main ferry stops and from St Mark's Square. Great rooms (choose one with a lake view). Excellent restaurant which must be tried. Above all, an extremely friendly and helpful staff. Yes, I arrived one day earlier than resesrvation but they were able to give me into a great room. A great find in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week Italy trip (Amalfi Coast, Tuscany, Venice and Lake Como). Most of the hotels that we stayed at were lovely 4-stars, and the trip was great. I cannot say enough good things about the Hotel Metropole. The location is fantastic (a 1 minute walk from St. Mark's Square), the hotel is gorgeous, the rooms are spotless and have all the amenities, and the service is that of a 5-star hotel. Aside from all of this, plus a great bar and excellent restaurant, the hotel has its own watertaxi stop (very unusual) and offers free private service to and from Murano. The hotel is also a steal at 200 Euros a night in peak season.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Venice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with a much needed warm welcome at the Hotel Metropole after a crowded water bus ride from the train station. I suggest taking a water taxi. Our rooms were gorgeous with nice patios overlooking Venice. Everything was within a short walking distance from the Hotel and the ambiance from every angle was amazing. There was a nice varietly for breakfast, and everything was fresh. A great way to begin a day of sightseeing. In the evening we retired to the beautiful candlelit patio in the back of the hotel. Very relaxing. It is such a quaint hotel and the rooms were very quiet. Cheers to a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This a beautiful, romatic hotel in a great location. I just hate that I went there with my sister and instead of a boyfriend

Reviews.Title: “5***** Hotel Metropole, Venice, Italy”
Reviews.Author: PortiaAnn
Reviews.Content: Prime location, short walk to St. Marks Square. Stayed here four nights, lovely romantic interior, every room different, filled with beautiful antigue furnishings. Splurge on a room facing the grand canal or at least the side canal. Our suite ( for a family of three) had a view of both the side canal and courtyard - nice touch. Property is immaculate with a helpful staff. Beautiful dining areas; yummy breakfast, great coffee; complimentary fruit in the room, as well as bathrobes. The courtyard is a pleasant respite from the hectic crowds. Be careful if you have knee problems, as the bridges have many steps, and may not be easy to traverse. Same goes for lugging suitcases across bridges to your hotel, pack light. Would definitely return. Venice is mysterious, take time to explore all its nooks and crannies, the many bridges themselves are worth investigating. It's easily walkable, but flat comfy shoes are a must.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MemphisCPA
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely beautiful hotel decorated in the Venitian style with luxurious fabrics, tapestries, antiques, and Venetian handblown chandeliers. The lobby is gorgeous and overlooks the lagoon just steps away from the Piazza San Marco. The restaurant has exceptional haute cuisine, however it is very pricey. Front Desk staff is very polite and helpful. The room was absolutely stunning with velvet upholstered walls, antique bed, dresser, and end tables, Venetian chandelier, and a view that looked out over the courtyard. The room was very large, as was the bathroom. The bath was fully renovated and had all the amenities. (A few tips on checking in....make sure you arrive in Venice either early or late to avoid carrying luggage threw throngs of crowds.) The comp breakfast was very, very good and served in a beautiful red velvet dining room. This hotel is expensive, but not as expensive as other more famous hotels nearby and still just as extravagant. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and the Hotel Metropole made a most magical trip to Venice even more memorable. Would definitely want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Special package”
Reviews.Author: beebes
Reviews.Content: We found a special on their website "Fit for A king, but not the Price". It was a petite suite, parking at the International Garage, a drink upon arrival and breakfast for 200E. Although it wasn't a room with a view, we throughly enjoyed the oversized room, beautiful linens and amentites. The staff was helpful and we ate in their dining room one night and the food was wonderful. We truly feel we got our monies worth.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen&Mike
Reviews.Content: We agonised over where to stay in Venice and finally chose the Metropole as it has it's own mooring, for water taxis. From the airport about 35 mins. Whatever you think,pay the extra for the private water taxi instead of the municipal water bus. If you haven't been before you'll feel like James Bond as you speed towards the hotel. We went with close friends, another couple and as we set eyes on the Metropole, we felt a bit let down. It's a dirty grey exterior with green shutters. Hmmm.... who chose this place then? We needn't have worried, inside the most perfect Venetian hotel you could imagine. Although relatively small, the place is full of antiques, lavish furnishings and thoughtfull touches. Staff are polite, attentive, but most of all warm and charming. As it was a joint aniversary, we dined one night in the hotel resturant. Imaginative menu was fautlessly presented amongst the candlight and red drapes. It really couldn't have been much better, although the bill was over Â£200 for four inc. wine & champagne. The Metropole is positioned in a relatively peaceful spot, about 5 mins stroll from St Marks square - so again ideal. Why anyone would want to stay near the Rialto Bridge - I cannot imagine. Although we walked everywhere in Venice directly from the hotel, we used the waterbuses aswell. A Gondola ride was good value and I found it more enjoyable than my cynicism had predicted. Also the trip to Murano, where the famous glass is made, was free and we weren't actually pressurised into buying anything. Felt guilty about not doing so though...... Incidentaly, I would also really reccomend the Berlitz Z pocket map that I bought, here in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel w/ Location and all the nice touches”
Reviews.Author: Chgofamily
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. This lovely hotel is located along the water way just steps to St. Mark's. It also has it's own dock for easy access upon arrival/departure w/ luggage. You can take the water bus to St. Marks if you like. I would absolutely stay here again. It is very "Venetian" in decor, fabric covered walls and all, and has music every night. One night piano, another jazz. The bar area is very cozy too. We had a jr. suite, very nice! The room had just enough antique furniture to give it a warm feel but not too much where you were afraid to actually use it. The bathroom was huge too and had just been redone in mosaic tile. Double tub, heated floors and all. The beds were comfortably firm with soft high quality linens and fluffy pillows. Our room faced the side street so it was not loud. It was nice to keep the windows open to hear the street music float in. Breakfast was included and very good. The one reason the hotel did not rate and "excellent" is because there was some confusion from the hotel on our wake up call. They said they wrote the incorrect room number down - I watched him write it and I think they just plain old forgot (4:30 a.m.). They never called the morning we were to check out and we really almost missed our very early morning flight. There are no alarm clocks in the room. We did not eat dinner at the hotel, it looked good but heard from other guests we may want to go elsewhere for the price. Take a water taxi from the airport if you can - find other folks at the airport going to the same area and share the cost - it is only 10 euro more total to drop at your individual hotels. ($90E total for 2 hotel drops - the taxis hold up to 6 persons) Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - dead posh!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lizzyd66
Reviews.Content: We only paid â‚¬150 a night for a double room in this fanatastic hotel. The hotel was full of character and had loads of nooks and cranny's, fantastic continental breakfast, very friendly waiting staff. Our room didn't have a view - looked out onto a marque in the garden! It was huge , very well furnished and comfortable - massive bed , sheer luxury really. We had coffees in the sitting room the first night - quite pricy at â‚¬10 for two (but probably average in Venice). The location of the hotel is a big selling point as well - very handy for everywhere and especially for the Alligua(?) motor bus that takes you to and from the airport. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Very accesible for Venice”
Reviews.Author: nonamesforme
Reviews.Content: January 2005 (not during Carnivale) The Hotel Metropole is very comfortable. Most luxurious bath I have had in Italy--heated marble floors, spacious and warm (January in Italy was a little chilly). Bedroom was average size--no upgrades offered--windows on courtyard were shuttered and unless I opened them, the room seemed dark, but I wasn't in the room much! Breakfast buffet (included) was generous. Staff is multilingual and was helpful with restaurant recommendation and with getting the correct vaporetto to the train station. The hotel is pricey for what you get, but midrange for Venice. It's extremely convenient to San Marco and to the San Zacchario vaporetto stop. I recommend the Alilaguno boat from the airport to San Zacchario (10 Euro, about an hour, but the fewest transfers of luggage unless you buy a taxi for greater cost). The hotel is 2 bridges to the right of the vaporetto, so be aware if you carry heavy luggage. Staff suggested the boat to Murano, but no pressure at all. If you want a hotel convenient to San Marco and the main attractions, I recommend this one. If you want to be off the beaten path or in a more "mysterious" location, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Metropole Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussiegal15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel in October, 2004. When we arrived early after our cruise the staff looked after our luggage until the 2pm check in. We had only paid for a side or back room but when we returned we were taken to a wonderful front/corner room with three windows overlooking the lagoon. What a view. The room was beautifully furnished in the Venetian style with a marble bathroom. The breakfast downstairs each morning was delicious and filled us up for a day of walking. We found the staff to be very pleasant and nothing was too much trouble. We would return again to this delightful hotel with the added bonus of its great position.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very nervous about staying at the Metropole after reading the recent reviews. After reading the negative comments...I felt compelled to provide a more balanced perspective. We just returned yesterday after four days in Venice and I cannot say enough wonderful things about our stay. We were interested in staying at Locanda Orseolo or the Danieli since both had good rates for the period we were traveling. However, the Metropole had a special rate that was too good to pass up so we decided to take the risk... We were in a beautiful suite for 150 euro/night including breakfast and a bottle of prosecco that was delivered to our room the first evening. The location is also perfect...very close to the Palazzo Ducale and Piazza San Marco and very close to the vaperetto stops for the airport and to get to anywhere else in Venice. The service was very attentive and we did not experience any of the aggressive behavior described by other guests re: trips to a glass factory in Murano. Additionally...there was a guitar player each evening in the lounge (which was a very comfortable location for an after dinner drink) And, the breakfast was definitely a far cry from the typical breakfast we received in other hotels throughout Italy, Spain and France.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful But Cold & Bug Infested”
Reviews.Author: hossem
Reviews.Content: At first site, this hotel exudes class. From the red carpet and its elegant ambience, there is no denying the 4 1/2 star rating. And the Angel Suite where we stayed is breathless. Complete with hanging angels, roman columns, and pristine artwork, this suite promised the ultimate in luxury. but (and you know this was coming), there was one very major problem....the mosquitos!! The room was infested with mosquitos as my wife and I were bit approx. 20 (yes twenty) times during our 3 nght stay there!! We resorted to covering ourselves up from head to toe, but to no avail, as we awoke to bites on our nose, cheeks, forehead, arms, etc. And when we informed the front desk, the clerk's response was "Wow, clever bugs" as he snickered. Needless to say i wasnt sharing his amusement. Another major problem was the heating. We stayed oct 13th thru oct 16th but it was unseasonably cool as the temp dropped to the low 40's in the evening/night. When we inquired about the heat, we were told that the "machines do not turn on until Nov 1" and were forced to light candles in a feeble attempt to keep warm. Once again, we were not pleased with the smugness of the front desk personnel who seemed to shrug everything off. The hotel restaurant food is okay, but definitely overpriced (our lunch was over $110). The location is convenient in that it is located 2 minutes from St. Mark's Square and along the waterfront with outdoor vendors. The Murano factory is about a 10 minute boatride away, and thanks to reviews posted here, I was able to resist the urge to buy those incredibly beautiful and overpriced ornaments. (I was able to get one of the ornaments at one of the waterfront shops for signficantly less). Overall, under different circumstances, this hotel would be a dream come true. But the mosquitos and the "angry landlord" treatment regarding the heat proved too much, and made this the worst hotel stay of my life!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SPOT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location! Take the expensive water taxi to it for sure. 5 blocks from the square. Gondolas out the front door. Our room was under 200e and was great - the room on the side canal with the balcony! Very classy facilities, marble bathroom, nice room, great bar, it was terrific! Take a water taxi all around the grand canal - it's even better than the gondola. We loved Metropole.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, convenient.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location. Water taxi from train station directly to the side door of the Hotel. Perfect if you have been traveling and lugging luggage for a few weeks. Decent hotel. Concierge, Enzo, very helpful. They do set you up to take a "Free" taxi to Murano, the glass blowing place. After the tour of the factory, you go to their showroom where they give you the hard sell. Cost me over $400. My wife got sold on some vases. Other than that, the place was pretty clean and the buffet breakfast was excellent. Probably won't find much better.
